name: The Children's Museum of Indianapolis
address: 3000 N Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46208, USA
reviews: We love the Children’s Museum! And I love that it’s always changing to keep our membership worth having.  The outdoor sports section was an amazing add on!  I do wish it was more affordable though.  When we have friends come into town we aren’t always able to go.

We have fun each time we go. Kids love the dinosaur exhibit and pop culture exhibit.  The outdoor sport area looks cool but it closes in the winter so we didn't see it this time.  There is an indoor sports exhibit too.  Good food court with a lot of options.  About 30.00 per adult.  20.00 for kids.  Ample free parking in their connected garage.  Great for all age children.  Easy to get to. Very clean and updated.  Certain exhibits change often.

Overall it’s really nice and updated, I would say the layouts rather strange and kind of maze-like. This is definitely a place for learning and fun, age group is about 5-10 I would say however, any age could enjoy what’s at the children’s museum. They offer a large amount of discounts for example: students or seniors. What I enjoyed most about this recent trip is the new addition of the Greece section. That area is an additional price however it’s offered for a limited time. There is more to come in 2020!

We love the museum. The staff are friendly and helpful. They really seem to have a passion for children. The facilities are clean and there is everything you need to have a successful trip. The Playscape is great for toddlers and even has a small confined area for crawling babies. Some of the exhibits are a little over my kids heads, but the map they pass out has age recommendations too. We love the family bathrooms and room for nursing mother's too. Can't wait to go back!

Great place even for adults! We went with no kids just to scope it out. Did not regret it! Also, they had a nice selection of food in the food court, not just concession food. They even had a salad bar. The China and Egypt exhibits were well done. Go see the planetarium show about how science fiction becomes fact, it was great and free with admission. The Greece exhibit has a lot of neat cultural facts that I didn't know. Very interesting!

name: Indianapolis Zoo
address: 1200 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: Was surprised by the dolphin show. Was very in-depth and to my knowledge one of the only ones at a zoo. However, the zoo itself was fairly small. A few of the exhibits were closed for renovations and we were in and out in less than 2 hours. For comparison we spent almost 4 hours and didn't see everything at the NC zoo. Surprisingly small for a large town and had to pay for parking on-site.

This is a wonderful zoo. We were lucky enough to have a couple extra hours before our flight out of Indianapolis and went to the zoo, which is about 15 minutes away from the airport.  So glad we did.  It was decorated with millions of lights.  The animals were out and about.  The dolphins are magnificent.  They have WALRUSES!!! Which is super rare. I'd love to go back in the summer and see more. Also,  during the holidays,  there is a Santa and you get a time slot for free when you arrive.  We didn't get to see him because of our flight time constraints.  I'm sure it would have been lovely.  
This zoo is a gem.

It was an awesome experience.   Beautifully decorated.   Everyone whom I encountered were exuding the Christmas spirit.  The temperature for this time of the year was awesome and the hot chocolate was great. Great appreciation for all who participated in hanging the lights and setting up the displays. Looking forward to next year.   Merry Christmas.

The zoo itself is nice and spacious. Different little activities for kids and interactions for everyone. Definitely an improvement over the years. However, a few things that stood out about this visit. One, my two year old made a remark a few times about the animals seeming sad (mainly all the the primate varieties and birds). Two, I didn't notice many foraging or entertainment options for many animals. That's kinda sad as an animal owner myself. And three, the macaw cage was SEVERELY lacking in opportunities. Macaws are very intelligent and even though they are in an aviary, there seemed to be many lacking opportunities. At the time of our visit I did not see any captive foraging for ANY BIDS HOUSED. Nor toys or puzzle opportunities. The larger macaws seemed stressed and agitated by the shear number of birds coupled with lack of entertainment and we're picking at each other. Not like bonded grooming but picking at feet and wings. As a bird owner it is hard to explain the disappointment. Overall, wasn't too bad but would definitely recommend more activities for animals l.

Recently went to Christmas at the Zoo. It just so happened to snow that night. The snow made it SO much better. Attractions and activities were nice as well.  Very festive. Would highly recommend on s snow day. Makes the lights shine brighter.

name: The Escape Room Indianapolis
address: 200 S Meridian St #220, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: First time escapers had a great time very hard though but fun.

This escape room was very well done. The clues were difficult, and our group was challenged on the intermediate and advanced rooms (we went twice). I loved how the rooms were decorated and the themes. This was a great activity for our multi-generational family over the holidays. Everyone enjoyed it, especially when we managed to escape. I would definitely recommend this place for an hour of fun.

Great way to spend an hour testing your collaboration skills with family, friends or coworkers.  We did the "Space 2112" room which I would rate as quite challenging.  Excellent props and staging. Better have a math whiz with you if you get this room.

We do a ton of room escapes so this is just our perspective.  We did the heist few years ago and it has way too many keys and the puzzles weren't our favorite so we wrote this place off. Then we did the art heist and loved it! The puzzles were simple and straightforward but the mechanisms were neat. The game master gave us some great recommendations for future rooms to try for our group. My family has also raved about their fishers location. Looking forward to coming back and doing some of the more complex rooms!
Great time. Coco our advisor did a terrific job!

name: Soldiers/Sailors Monument
address: 1 Monument Cir, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Beautiful monument, the water feature is an amazing backdrop for an awesome piece of art.  The roundabout makes it feel like international destination.  Great stop in the middle of a 10 mile run.

Recently had some downtime and decided to check this place out. Didn't actually realize how high this place was until I reached the top. Elevator was busted which is not an issue for me, but I think you'd get more out of it by climbing the stairs anyway. Nice staff at the gift shop and overall a pleasent experience if you've never been there. The attention to detail on the structure itself is worth having a look. Go there when you have some time to enjoy the atmosphere of the city moving around you.

We really enjoyed exploring downtown Indy on foot. This was one of our destinations. Unfortunately, we couldn't enter to climb to the top as it was closed because they were installing Christmas lights. But it was still very enjoyable to observe all the intricate details of this monument from the outside.

Recognized as one of the world’s outstanding monuments. The largest outdoor memorial in the United States to be dedicated to the common soldier. Surrounded by restaurants and businesses and is a great place to relax and observe.

The monument is enormous and beautiful to look at. We climbed to the top and really enjoyed the challenge. The views were good, but not absolutely breathtaking for me. I can’t help but compare these kinds of views to the Columbia center skyview observatory in Seattle and that’s hard to beat. Still really glad we did it, though! 

The staircase gets pretty tight at the top, so it can be a bit crowded, but the elevator wasn’t running which meant everyone was walking up and down, making a bit more congested than it might have been otherwise. The last several flights have space for one person side to side, while the flights below have room for about 2.

name: White River State Park
address: 801 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: No restroom, overrated. We went there from out of town in a late Sunday afternoon and the visitor center was closed so no restroom (and no map to show where the restrooms are). We had to walk to the other end of the canal walk for the restroom. Parking is expensive for a public park.

I haven't been here in several years but enjoyed the time I spent here. The park is beautiful and the canal walk was unexpectedly quiet and peaceful, especially for being in downtown Indianapolis. Its conveniently close to the zoo also. Parking can be an issue so give extra time to find a spot or pay to park which can be a bit pricey.
I always have lots of fun bringing my puppy out for walks here!! It’s very nice and clean and there’s a lot to see
It's beautiful and fun at at any time of year. I love going. It's very accessible to everyone but it can be hard to find parking when there are multiple events going on downtown.
Great place to send an afternoon. Lots to do and see. The museums are nearby and you are only a short distance from Victory Field.

name: The HandleBar
address: 501 Madison Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Great experience for a bachelor's party! They just got bikes that have motor assistance so if you're nervous that it might be too hard they have you covered! You stop at various iconic spots throughout Indianapolis and gain a different perspective of the city.

Had a great time on the HandleBar last weekend!  Kyle was an awesome driver and host, pointing out great places to visit on our stops.  Kyle kept the energy high and the tunes rolling!  Highly recommend HandleBar Indy!

We had soooo much fun on our Handle Bar experience. Lucas, our driver, was fun and engaged. He definitely kept the party going! I would recommend to anyone looking to have some fun with friends and meet some new friends as well. We will be back!
Had a great experience.  First time taking tour . Was a blast . And our driver Chris was great! will suggest to friends. And will definitely be back.

We had a wonderful time doing the HandleBar! It was super rainy and dreary, but they were still game! They even gave us ponchos!! I owe a big thanks to our BarHandler Lucas- great guy.  He made the experience so wonderful! He was fun, patient, and easy going. He pretty much doubled as a photographer as well. Awesome guy!! We had such an awesome time we are already talking about going back to do another one. It was a surprise for my boyfriend and they made it super easy for me to have someone drop off our cooler earlier in the day to make the whole “surprise” seamless. The whole process from purchasing the Handlebar on line, obtaining FAQs, and signing the waiver was super smooth and easy. We were very happy! Thanks guys!

name: Indiana State Museum
address: 650 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: If you plan on taking more than one person, buying the membership is worth it! Got to review the opioid exhibit. That was truly amazing, they’ve made the exhibit very nice. Also knowing that it can be emotional for people they’ve made it very big in there. There is lots of room to sit down and lots of different ways to cope. There is music, writing etc. great ideas! You can tell this idea was thought through.

The cafe here at the Museum was a wonderful surprise.  We had a delightful lunch.  Definitely will plan to go hungry on my future visits here.  We did soup and grilled cheese combos (This and That they called it).  My tomato basil soup was awesome, but my daughter’s Chicken Velvet was the best chicken soup I’ve ever tasted.  The grilled cheese had turkey and roasted red pepper on sourdough.  Wonderful lunch.

Great place for children and adults. We have been several times and it never disappoints. Always friendly and helpful staff, very clean and all the displays are in great shape and well kept. Not wore out like other museums. I highly recommend going and taking the kids. If you do the Imax movie, you get free parking in the garage! So totally worth it!

This is a great place to learn about Indiana's history. It caters to kids with hands on exhibits. Great for school groups and events. It's right on the canal which offers lots of activities. They offer fantastic traveling exhibits and have an IMax theater with new releases available. Great place to go.

Very interesting permanent exhibits with regular special exhibits. Parking is easy and rarely very crowded. It's nice to be able to walk out into the canal in nice weather. Museum restaurant it's pricey but the food is very good.

name: Eagle Creek Park
address: 7840 W 56th St, Indianapolis, IN 46254, USA
reviews: I love this park!  In all of Indianapolis area you'll not find a better park to enjoy the day with your people at.  Great fishing, Rick's boatyard for dinner after hiking the nicely trimmed trails.  Nature center, Swimming beach in summertime.  If you enjoy knocking around the little white ball, Visit Eagle Creek golf club. 2 Sycamore for the better players and The Pines for you hackers. So plan on a full day and go Rock the Park. This Tony Sullivan See ya next time. Be safe! Always.

This state park turned City park is awesome, packed with animal life, especially birds of many kinds. I haven't found a park around Indianapolis with as wide of a variety of bird species. Trails are long and have some very pretty and calming views. Park pass cost is fairly expensive especially since it only covers that park, but if you live or work near the location, you can easily get your moneys worth in the amount of time you can spend there. There are several extras here such as boats, zip lines, and nature centers to give the place an extra bit of fun for the whole family.

I spent a fall holiday in this amazing preserve. Each day a new point of view. Fall colors, water Birds and tree life were perfect nature reflection. Great photography too. Miles of.accessible trails and beautiful interpretive Museum. I enjoyed miles of hiking walking and jogging trails. In addition the Peace Learning Center located on the facility was a treasure and is doing great work for community programs around the nation. Nature, Community, active lifestyle, and preservation/ conservation is a win.

We love this place! We go as often as possible with our two kids. We primarily hike, but also enjoy the ornithology center and Earth Discovery center. We’ve had birthday parties there (always popular) and many days of homeschool at picnic tables. As our kids get older we look forward to more adventures there!

great trails with a diverse scenery including a vast lake and dense forest areas. fishing spots, benches, and a playground. it was even a rather gloomy and rainy day and I still had a great time! will visit again to walk every trail ❤️

name: Indianapolis Motor Speedway
address: 4790 W 16th St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews:
Visiting from out of town with very little exposure to racing in general, I really enjoyed our visit. I loved the tour of the track, hearing about the traditions of the Indy 500, and exploring the museum with all of the history it contains.

If you enjoy auto racing, or are interested in learning about something new, this would be a fun activity. 

We were there for two hours (including the track tour) and it felt like a good amount of time for someone who knows so little about racing. If you have more knowledge going in, you could easily spend way more time in the museum. There’s so much to read and learn. 

4 stars because for me, it was fun, but not an absolute must.

Truly a dream come true!! I have been a life long Indy fan. I showed up Saturday morning right as the museum opened. I did the kiss the bricks tour which included admission into the museum. A lap around the track was memorable. Highly recommend this experience to any racecar fan

A great facility that I was lucky enough to tour this Fall. The most fascinating thing is the "City" within the infield - all the activity, buildings, etc., is amazing. We were able to tour the pit lane, luxury boxes, and victory lane - all of which was amazing. It was also great to see the winner of the BC39 midget race displayed next to the Indy 500 and Brickyard 400 winners - that was really special to a dirt track racing fan.

The best time to see the lights on the track was New Year's Eve! Hardly any traffic and drove through without a hassle. The lights were great, but my wife loved being able to drive on the actual track. Granted, it was about 4 mph, but we were there. On the track. Down the straightaway!

Definitely the oldest racetrack you've ever been to. Definitely cool. It's worth it I think to pay for the parking passes to get a good parking spot near the track. Just buy them ahead of time before they jack the prices up!

name: Indianapolis Motor Speedway Museum
address: 4750 W 16th St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: Participated in the Kiss the Bricks Tour and it was awesome. The tour is only 30 minutes long but you get to ride the racetrack and hear about the history of it. The museum is beautiful and very informative. Definitely a place you want to take time and check out as a tourist if you ever came to visit the beautiful city.

Throughout the summer and fall, in the parking lot next to the museum, they also have Cars and Coffee! So, you can walk around with a cup of coffee while browsing the cars and talking to their owners. Then, you can head into the museum! It’s great!
Love this place. The staff has always been friendly with my girls. The knowledge and love of the track and it’s history is shown through every interaction. This is a must for any race fan.

A good source of history and old cars that used to race in Indianapolis. Recommend paying the extra money to ride the bus around the track. I wasn't able to see the track in its entirety from the museum though, hence the recommendation to ride the bus.

There is a vibe in the place!
100+ years of history, loved my visit last year in October.
The workmanship in the older cars is amazing.
A highlight of our trip in the US.

name: Eiteljorg Museum
address: 500 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Jingle Rails is the reason we came but we had a wonderful experience exploring the rest of the museum. They had puzzles and other fun things for the little ones, well and us grown people too.  Definitely a Great way to spend a few hours. We got a year pass so we could enjoy other exhibits throughout the year. Jingle Rails was Amazing.

Amazing exhibit of Native American and wild west paintings and sculptures.  Gift shop has really nice items for sale in all price ranges. Cafe is a good place to take a break. Would definitely go again if I return to Indianapolis!

Eiteljorg is a must see when in Indy. The collection is diverse with an emphasis on Western art, but also interpretive areas with artifacts and artwork of North American Indian cultures and regions. They have excellent contemporary exhibits and a children's exploration area. When possible, parking is validated in their garage. We also had a meal at the cafe. The butternut squash and beet salad was tasty and prices affordable. Loved the southwest influenced interior design.

Was really cool! Went specifically for the Jingle Rails exhibit and love it, worth $15 alone. We also saw the rest of the museum too, less interactive than I thought it be. It's mostly art museum though there are two exhibits on the second floor that are interactive one of them goes through the history and culture of different Native American communities the other is for art that you are allowed to touch(my favorite exhibit). 
Overall it's good for gathering information but I wouldn't suggest you bring your kids, but they might get bored.

One of the best museums in the US for American Indian and West American art. Quite an extensive collection of art on display and they have different special exhibits throughout the year. Jingle Rails during the Christmas season is a favorite. Each year they seem to add something new to the display. This year it was the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Amazing how it is all made of nature materials. Highly recommend.

name: Indiana World War Memorial
address: 55 E Michigan St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
We absolutely loved our visit to the Indiana world war memorial. 
So much in fact that we will be bringing our 7 children back to see all the wonders the Museum has to offer. 
Truly is an amazing place to walk through and look at all the history of the men and women from Indiana who have been a part of all the wars. 
Really loved all the info on the USS Indianapolis. It was really cool to see some of the people who went through the days and nights after the sinking. 
And it's all free. So go and check it out, learn about Indiana's history in war.  It's worth it. 
The place was very clean and well done and the staff is very friendly. 
We will absolutely be back.

Such a gem in downtown Indy. We just walked by, and were like "this is an impressive building". Free entry, friendly staff, in mid week there was almost no one there. 

Have to start by going to the upstairs memorial - breathtaking

Then go through time in the exhibits, all are authentic and very informative. You can spend hours or just a quick visit, depending how avid you are on history

Excellent museum in a stunning and conveniently located building downtown. The museum itself is very well laid out, with amazing and informative displays covering every conflict from pre-revolutionary times to the present day, with an emphasis on Indiana's involvement and many significant contributions. Definitely an informative, entertaining, and humbling experience. If you have any interest in history, this is a DO NOT MISS experience.

A really fantastic collection of war memorabilia and artifacts...a truly breathtaking shrine and wonderfully peaceful interiors. A MUST SEE when visiting Indy.  The building outside is truly gorgeous... the interiors are equally so. 
A hidden gem for those interested in history and warfare.

A unique treasure hidden in plain sight. This downtown landmark is chock full of historically important and rare exhibits and artifacts. The auditorium is a one of a kind look into a bygone era. Crafted in ways with materials that just aren't available today. Well worth a visit!

name: Holliday Park
address: 6363 Spring Mill Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46260, USA
reviews:
Beautiful spacious park
 Great trails in a wooded area along with acres of lush lawn . Cool playground. Something for everyone,  including 4 legged furry family members.  It's spread out so every area has it's own purpose,  not jammed into a small amount of land
Clean well landscaped park. Plenty of trails in the woods. I had no idea this park was here till we stumbled upon it
Great location. Fun park for all. Good play areas. Nice parking. Great walk, jog, bike, and dog walk park!

Took my two pit bull puppies and the family here a couple of time this summer. Loved the trail and the paths. Nice place to go if you don't want to be bothered with loose or unattended dogs or children for that matter lol.
My favorite place in the city! Been visiting since childhood and it's always a pleasure. Please go! You will love it!

name: Twisted Room Escapes Indianapolis
address: 3145 E Thompson Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46227, USA
reviews:
Came here for my husband's birthday with our kids, age 10 and 7. We had a blast! The kids didnt want to leave. We did the Alice in wonderland room. It was age appropriate but still challenging, even for us adults. This was our first escape room experience so we did have to ask for more clues than I would like to admit. The hints were subtle enough to help you but not too much to take away from the challenge. So this is a great place for beginners and frequent escape room lovers. The staff were understanding and explained everything. 
I booked our slot the same day and had no troubles navigating their website. Customer service was out of this world. I really felt welcomed and comfortable with our visit. I would recommend them to anyone looking to build confidence in your relationships to someone looking to kill time.

Absolutely LOVED this! Our first time and won't be the last! We played the Alice and Wonderland themed room. 

Our ages ranged from 11yrs old to 40's, all being able to participate. 

The reviews for this place are all amazing and a huge reason why we went to this escape room.

 This is totally worth the money and such a great experience. The details in the the rooms were incredible and the staff were so funny, friendly, and helpful.

 I could go on and on about this place!!!! Totally a must on your "things to-do" list!😁

This place is amazing! We have done many escape rooms and this is by far our new favorite place to go! The staff is very nice, engaging, and accommodating! The rooms are great! You really feel like you are in the environment of the room! We will be coming back to do every single room they have!

Twisted Room Escapes is one of the best escape rooms in Indianapolis. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The waiting lobby has a lot of fun activities to pass the time. Our group did the submarine room (we heard this is the most difficult room) and it was a perfect blind of challenge, plenty of puzzles for everyone to work on at the same time, and the attention to detail in the room was amazing. Our game moderator was awesome. She did a great job of helping us along when we needed it but also let us figure out most things on our own. We got out with just 17 seconds left! We will definitely be coming back to try all the other rooms.

We did the Submarine room with 4 people and barely made it out in time! So fun and challenging. The staff was amazing & helpful, clues well designed to 'nudge' you without giving it away, and the payoff was my favorite (epic music) and made me feel like a WINNER! Go to Twisted Room if you want to have a great time and stretch your mind!

name: Conner Prairie
address: 13400 Allisonville Rd, Fishers, IN 46038, USA
reviews: I was wowed that the presentations were something like out of Disney World. In order for it to be so realistic feeling, the presentations combine physical props with digital ones that is high quality. You really feel like you’ve traveled back in time. My husband and I had a Great time. He went a lot as a kid, so he was showing me around while also being pleasantly surprised by new additions since he had last been years ago.

Good, educational experience. I have also attended field trips there. They do a good job in the field trips but note that the picnic area isn’t the best. It is still an amazing place and I would suggest for elementary schoolers and family.

Beautiful land, amazing fun to do with the family. We went on my daughters field trip in the fall and it was just gorgeous. Neat to walk through and have fun while learning at the same time. A picturesque day!

Great place to take your kids all year round inside or out they get things inside to see plus in the summertime see how people used to do pioneer age before gas-electric phones are they even invented how they used to do things back then some people still do it that way today and technologies or flop people do not keep the technology they refuse to use it but this is a good place to take your kids all year roundChick-fil-A hours and so he could have a really good place in the good place to eat to

I haven't been here since I was a kid, but I recently saw that they were having a free admission day. My boyfriend, kids, and I had a blast. The kids were super excited to explore and learn. We especially loved Benjamin in the makesmith workshop. He was so helpful with the boys and they loved using all the tools.

name: Fort Harrison State Park
address: 6000 N Post Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46216, USA
reviews: One of the most beautiful places in Indianapolis. The park is always a great place to bike and run. There are events going on here pretty regularly as well. If you want a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Indy daily life and need nature in your life this is your place.

Excellent play structure, reminds my girls of a castle which they love. The spray grounds in the summer time are a nice addition. Usually busy. Parking lot available. I wish there were a few more benches and shady areas. Other wise it is a nice park.

A wonderful place to go for your walks and enjoy nature of all kinds. I was there in March and saw deer at the side of the road.  They have a large playground and open area for all your outdoor activities. There is a great nature center at this park. Check them out sometime soon.

We visited this place in September. Very nice people here, we came for the horse riding experience. As others have pointed out: it IS just basically sitting on a horse while it walks the path. That doesn't diminish from the experience I don't think, because that's what they tell you it is. Don't expect to have freedom with their horses. It isn't your pet.
We had lots of fun here, and it was an extremely pleasant day. Kudos to the whole team at this place!

Long trails and a large hill for sledding, limited bird population which was quite surprising for a park of that size. Very large areas throughout to enjoy, nice kids area with a slide built into a hill. Great location for taking your family or for an enjoyable walk, run, or bike.

name: Garfield Park Conservatory
address: 2505 Conservatory Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews:
As a wedding photographer, I couldn't recommend Garfield Park Conservatory enough for clients looking for a small intimate ceremony or elopement. My clients planned their wedding quickly from Florida, and the conservatory was quite helpful and responsive to them as they planned long distance in three weeks' time. Garfield Park was even willing to let us come an hour before their ceremony to capture their wedding portraits in the greenhouse, and with the perfect March day outside, we were able to capture some stunning photos outside on their property as well. 

The conservatory provides that beautiful greenery feel, especially useful during the cooler months of the year in Indiana. While the space doesn't accommodate many guests, this couple's family gathered around the space and celebrated when these two became husband and wife. 

Again, hands down this is a great venue for those looking for a small intimate setting for their wedding ceremony.

Beautiful space to spend some time during bad weather. Many beautiful plants, flowers and trees. Couple peaceful waterfalls to sit down for a break. Looking forward to going back and checking out the sunken garden when it’s warmer.
Small but compact. Plants are thriving and in bloom! Gorgeous moss covered waterfall with a lily pad koi pond. Ooo. Seems like it’s be a divine venue for a wedding.

A hidden gem! Cheap admission and a wonderful variety of plants. Take a tropical respite at this beautiful Conservatory. Don't forget to also visit the art center! Definitely my favorite park in Indianapolis!
What a great fun exhibit! The kids and I had a great time trying to find everything on the scavenger hunt. We saw different gnomes everytime we were looking for something.

name: The Escape Room Fishers
address: 8890 E 116th St #210, Fishers, IN 46038, USA
reviews: A fun and interactive activity. The Titanic room was cool! Every staff member was friendly and welcoming. It's nice to have a parking garage and the place is easy to find. Our tour guide, Mason, was cool and helpful! I would definitely recommend this for families and groups, big or small. Great time!
Tons of fun! Challenging and great for family or team building activity.

We played A Night at the Castle and it was awesome. My group escaped with just a little over a minute left and the way out was a bit of a mad dash. The room has great puzzles but there is a physical aspect that can be a little rough. Our game masters were Sam and Hannah and they were awesome, big shout outs to them for the clues and entertainment before starting.
Matt H. was our guide and this experience was awesome. Totally recommend it!

Really love doing escape room. This time we did a really hard one, didn't feel like there was enough time to since all the puzzles and proceed to the next level. Unfortunately another group got added to our group to full the room to max capacity.. Which was too many people. There were people standing around unable to participate and it was too crowded. Otherwise the rooms are unique and challenges are different. I highly recommend it. Especially with people you know.

name: Benjamin Harrison Presidential Site
address: 1230 N Delaware St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: The most Prestigious home in Indiana. Don't miss out of the President Benjamin Harrison home. The story about his ministry, lawyer duties and most important his supportive family which included his artist wife. Don't miss this tour and come back for lawn croquet and garden tour in the summer.
Great guided tour. There's military and veterans discount. 2 adults totaled $11. Tour is about an hour. Mostly original stuff inside the home.
The Benjamin Harrison Presidential House was definitely worth the visit! The reenactors were very convincing, believable and entertaining. I plan to bring my grandchildren back for a visit.

Tire guide was very knowledgeable and spent extra time with us animal all it questions. I never realized what a dynasty the Harrison family was. Benjamin Harrison v signing the declaration of Independence, William Henry Harrison serving as our ninth president (briefly), and of course Benjamin Harrison serving one term between the two Grover Cleveland administrations.
Great informative tour of the home of our 23rd president. Very kind tour guides and staff ! One of my favorite presidential sites I’ve visited.

name: Garfield Park
address: 2345 Pagoda Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews:
I love Garfield park. As a child and even in my teens my brother and others from our neighborhood hung out there on a regular basis. 
I was there on this visit for the spring flower and  bulb show and sale. It was very beautiful. My mother and I was able to purchase some beautiful plants.
Today was a great day in the park. Packed with people. The sound of kids having fun and dogs barking. It was a good for fresh air. Love this park.

Garfield park is normally a secluded place. It's great for time with your significant other or time with family. Due to the little to no interruptions you may have, the only interruption I had was a local asking for directions

Beautiful park. Lots of events happening all the time. We went to a Valentine's Day art event that was teriffic fun. The people were super friendly, and the artist were awesome! We loved the hands on creating theme of the night. There was even live music and a brewery hosted the cash bar. I'd go to another event hosted by them anyday.

A beautiful park with wonderful people. I regularly run through Garfield park and use its trails to get me to places throughout the city by bike. Living near the park feels like a breath of fresh air from typical city living.

name: Indianapolis Canal Walk
address: Canal Walk, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: I'm from out of town, but this will continue to be a must-visit place whenever I come back! Although it was February, I could tell how alive the canal must become once the weather turns. Loved all the cool sites and things to see!
Great hangout. Very clean, well policed and very relaxing. Good with kids, just keep in mind that there is no barrier between the walkway and the canal.
Gorgeous stretch of walkway... definitely a visit whenever we're in Indianapolis. Walking, running, Pokemon Go are highly recommended.

My girl and I spent the day there. Had a great experience. Great atmosphere with plenty of places to sit without people all in your business. Very relaxing time spent there and will go back when the weather breaks. Parking was not an issue. One thing...do not go there later in the night. Gang kids are everywhere acting like fools. Daytime good, night bad.
Very serene location in the city (though to be fair, I visited this place on Thanksgiving.) Great atmosphere for jogging, walking your dog or simply releasing stress.

name: Rhythm! Discovery Center
address: Claypool Court Building, 110 W Washington St A, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: This place was super cool! I highly recommend going early because the kids and I went when it first opened and we had the place to ourselves. There’s a ton of gongs, bells, shakers, and various other instruments for the kids to try out. Tons! There’s also a few areas which are roped off but the employees explain to you that the museum is interactive except for the roped off areas. There’s interactive screens which tell you about the instruments and two awesome studio spaces you can drum on and change the venue with buttons. Love, love, loved it here and highly recommend it.

Love love love this museum! Small but totally worth the visit...from the drum circle to the soundproof jam session rooms and ALL of the interactive exhibits. We are from Chicago and next visit to Indianapolis we will definitely be back. Thank you!
Amazing stop... fully interactive displays.  Perfect for any percussion enthusiast.

I’m a drummer, and if you’ve never beat on any percussion instrument and are just dying to do it, this is the place for you. If not, save your money. They need to get in with the state museum or supplement the experience with something else. BUT, the drum heads and cymbals on the drum sets you can play are ultra cool because they are SO quiet! You could jam on them in an apartment!

Visited Indy so many times and didn't realize this place existed.  I started drumming a couple of years ago, but whether a beginner, expert or someone who never played before in their life, this place is a great way to spend an hour or two.  Pretty much anything you can hit to make a sound (including giant cymbals, wood blocks and more) as well as classic drum kits (and even one made out of Lego) are here. And much of it you can have a.go on!

name: Indiana Medical History Museum
address: 3045 W Vermont St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: Strange, delightful, spooky, humbling. Loved the tale of the rich history. Tours start on the hour for $10 ($5 students with ID)...come a little early and you’ll get to look around at a bunch of human brains. There’s stories about each human. That was the stuff that kinda “hits home” and gave me creepy feels. Loved the medicine bottles! Neat neat neat.

A nice activity for an hour, I recommend this museum for anybody who can stomach it. It's not gross but there are things (like brains, child skeleton, etc) that might not suit everyone. Our guide was nice and I felt she let us explore the rooms with adequate timing. $10 to get in and they have a small parking lot northwest of the building. Small but with enough parking. We walked up to the steps 2 min before the hour and were let in after she unlocked the door. They accept credit card. Very informative tour! I will definitely be coming back with visitors!!

This place was fascinating! Our guide Doug, was so knowledgeable and it was really nice to read the humanizing stories that went along with the specimens. So many neat things to see and beautiful old furniture and history. 10/10 would recommend.

Very interesting tour!!! Would definitely do again to see all the unique items! The ladies conducting the tours and greeting you are amazing and knowledgeable about the history of the museum and able to answer questions and provide a good history lesson all while having a good time! Thank you ladies for a great visit!

This museum has tours that last almost exactly one hour. It is the cheapest museum I have ever been to. With probably the most knowledgeable hosts of any museum I've ever been to. Now they can't answer all of your questions, but if they can't then they usually write it down and find someone who can cuz that's exactly what they did to me when I went here a year ago. I took a friend here just the other day and it was just as awesome of an experience. They've got the stories of the patients, not just the medical descriptions. This place could very easily entertain you for days on end, and it truly saddens me that the tours can only be one hour long. I also recommend going there over the summer because the medical garden is also very interesting. They've got every plant in there labeled with common name, scientific name,

name: Central Canal
address: Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: A nice place in downtown Indy to take a stroll, bike ride, or paddle boat.  It is safe with a variety of art and architecture to look at.
I like this place, it's quite beautiful, designed based on City Vanice, I guess. Log walk or long paddle boat, or cycling.
Clean and safe path thru downtown Indy.

By far the best hidden gem in greater downtown. Water fountains & falls, bridges of iron & stone, art, architecture, fish, paddle boats, gondola rides, mammoths & war memorials, open green fields, amphitheaters of grass & stone facing wide river bends, walkers and skaters, joggers and bikers.
We finally made it to the last outdoor concert of the season & it was a perfect date night!

name: Oldfields–Lilly House & Gardens
address: 4000 N Michigan Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46208, USA
reviews: Absolutely worth an afternoon of wandering. The Indianapolis Art Museum is wonderful and the Lily estate is included in that admission. The gardens and grounds are fabulous. The landscape designer was the same man who later designed and developed Central Park in NY. I happened to arrive on a Friday when the Lily house has free tours (2 pm). The house was the country house of the Lily family and it was marvelous to stroll through to see their furnished home with libraries, secret doors, game rooms, and even the garage with a vintage car inside. The gardens took hours for me to wander through. They were setting up on the lawn for a wedding as I left. Beautiful place.

It's a gorgeous area that is a piece of history as much as it is a potential venue. Weddings are popular to have here. The garden is very beautiful and it's a wonderful way to spend the day with someone you care about.
I loved visiting this house, there was so much history.  Hopefully you can visit sometime, you will love it.  Visiting at Christmas was extra special.
I love Oldfields. The museum, Lilly House and gardens are outstanding. Spring time is a good time to visit the gardens.
Their Christmas lights display with coordinating music from The Nutcracker is da bomb.  Actually a very romantic evening.. spectacular.

name: White River Gardens
address: 1200 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: Gorgeous in the spring and summer.  Free admission with Zoo admission.  This garden is the gem of Indianapolis.  It's not only beautiful and well maintained, they have an indoor butterfly "garden" as well.  In the gardens there are nice, picturesque almost private little nooks to rest in, a big beauful space for weddings, fountains, ponds, water lilies, a zillion different flower species and some whimsical animal statuettes.  At first I felt the whimsy was out of place.  The next time I went, I really looked at them and they are fun and one particularly hilarious statuette of 3 ducks walking on the edge of a pond and the middle duck is expounding with his wing, and looks like he wants to push that duck into the water.  This one gave me the biggest laugh!  This place is definitely a must-see in Indianapolis!
Gorgeous gardens. I thourghly enjoyed myself. Took several pictures that friends now use as screen savers on their computer. Also took pictures for artistic muse. Just lovely.
I enjoyed the indoor garden. The outside garden did not look in a great shape. Maybe because it was around Christmas time and some of the plants were dead/in a bad shape!

This is a really nice indoor and outdoor garden. We went after we went to the zoo and it was a nice way to wind down. The butterfly garden is really cool. The outdoor area is really awesome. It feels like an old fashioned British outdoor garden. You get in free with zoo tickets I think.

Nice scenery with green and blue environment in Indy downtown. Good place to exercise and spend an evening. Well maintained. Connected to white river and Indy zoo. Garden looks but antique but clam and quite place to relax. The butterfly arenas are worth to enjoy.

name: THE VIRGINIA B. FAIRBANKS ART & NATURE PARK: 100 ACRES AT NEWFIELDS
address: 1850 W 38th St, Indianapolis, IN 46228, USA
reviews:
Wonderful grounds for walking. The path is dirt, but easy enough to walk on. Although this winter the conditions dont allow for a full lake loop, I enjoyed what I could.

The art installations throughout are neat and creative. Come and see for yourself!

Winter Lights were beautiful. Kids did OK on that cold day. Would have been nice to go without kids and tour the buildings more thoroughly, but it was still a great family activity. We'll try to return next year.

Very well done walking tour. Dress warm but you can always stop for hot chocolate. It is an affordable date night, family outing or just a great experiential gift idea.  Could also be considered to be a romantic experience.  
Start a tradition.  Go.
Very nice collection, helpful staff and solid events and tours.  Well worth regular visits if you live here or one visit if you're a tourist.

This is great place for a nature walk. There was many areas to explore and see. We visited the guest center to cool off in the AC and watch the wildlife from the comfort of indoors, which helped us recharged to keep exploring out in the heat. We really enjoyed the trails. 

If this review was helpful please hit the thumbs up! Thanks!

name: The USS Indianapolis National Memorial
address: Canal Walk, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: It's a beautiful park right off the canal.My girlfriend and I were visiting from San Diego and found it was a wonderful place to stroll through. There is a zoo however it wasn't open when we pass by. Maybe it was a little early in the morning. But the canal and river area are both very beautiful.

These pictures are actually of downtown Indianapolis, Indiana. Includes the gorgeous and beautiful Canal Walk. Include some pictures from the state fair that's held in Indianapolis right outside of Indianapolis, Indiana. The city, and area businesses, along with the entire Indianapolis, Indiana Community have come together and made a beautiful, welcoming, and unique downtown area. They have horse-drawn carriage, to peddling beer bars smiley. :-) :-)
Very nice place to take a long walk or bike ride, beautiful view
Incredibly moving.

Small but important memorial to the last naval vessel lost during WWII. The memorial tells the story of the USS Indianapolis, including its accomplishments prior to its sinking. It's very tasteful, and in a great location near the canal.

name: Veal's Ice Tree (please note the tree can only be made if we have temperatures below freezing)
address: 6445 Mimosa Ln, Indianapolis, IN 46259, USA
reviews: What a magical place.  So happy the family continues the tradition.  My kids and I loved the tree in all its glory.

This place is absolutely amazing! Very family-friendly and worth the snow and cold. The people are so nice and sweet! I reccomend this place to anyone in indiana looking for a place to have fun and enjoy life the way it is.
One of my favorite things to go see every winter when it goes up! Love it!
Awesome icon of winter in Indiana. A must see. While we were there, the owner was climbing on it moving the hoses to make it bigger.

Admire the dedication this family has to bring something beautiful for millions of people to see every year! Please keep up the tradition as long as you can!! Pretty neat to be Birthday twins with the founder! (photo is my own from 01/2018 tree)

name: Go Ape Zipline & Adventure Park
address: 5855 Delong Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46254, USA
reviews: Julia was a great instructor! Had such a fun time at Go Ape! Definitely a work out and need some upper body strength at times. You can get through the course without much physical endurance, but can’t be too out of shape. It’s fun being up in the trees. They care a lot about safety, too, and will always be paying attention making sure you’re doing things right! They’re also doing waivers electronically which rocks!

Took my cousin to GoApe as a last adventure of summer right before she starts up school again.  We went on a weekday morning, so it wasn't crowded at all.  Even though it was warm out, it was shady in the trees and they had lots of water available at stations on the ground.  Cabin manager and instructors were very friendly and helpful.  You start out at a lower training site that way you feel safe once in the higher trees.  At the first long zip line she was a bit nervous, but by the end of the course they were her favorite part.  Go Ape is a great way to get outside and try something different.

So much fun! My family went and we had such a great time. The ladies there were so helpful, even setting up a brake line for grandma! Even though it rained they gave us a quick rain check that we can't wait to use!

I got over my fear of heights here. That's why I went. The first course was hard for me but by the time I got to the fifth course, I wanted more! 

I brought my son and daughter with me. Both enjoy video games and hisss at the sunlight. So, really, I FORCED my son and daughter to go with me. They ended up having fun too! It was actually nice to be outside and have them put the electronics down. Parents: kids telling you "no, I don't want to go" will eventually learn to have fun here by the second course.

Two birds, one stone. Having the kids outside wins by a long shot but conquering a fear is also awesome.

Wow! This was awesome! Friendly and informative staff.  Clean and we'll run facility.  The training was detailed and I felt safe.  Staff patrol the area to be sure of safety and help with any questions.  If taking kids (only 10 and above!) be sure to check the height requirement as well. Also, I would ask for one of the guides to train the kids separate from the group to be sure they are focused!!!!

name: Scottish Rite Cathedral
address: 650 N Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
A classy place to set the ambiance for our daughter's formal wedding two weeks ago. The gorgeous, giant chandelier in the ballroom, rich wood floors, walls, posts and all the decor made this the most memorable day of her life. The bridal suite and grooms quarters are perfect for getting ready. Having the mezzanine for cocktails took care of them until dinner. 
The staff was super to work with. Thank you Scottish Rite Cathedral!
This place is so drench in history, not made with a nail! The details are amazing of this building. Easy access and great parking. Love history it's a great place to start!

This place is steeped in history. The entire building is absolutely beautiful. They have a ballroom that is absolutely gorgeous. This place really does downtown Indianapolis Justice. Some of the stained glass in this building is breathtaking. The staff is friendly and polite. They also serve lunch here every day. Certainly a unique place to visit.
The building on the outside was absolutely beautiful. Unfortunately I stop by on the weekend so I was unable to go inside. I am definitely planning to stop back next time Im in town.
I use their monthly parking and love it. Very reasonable rates, excellent security, wonderful staff and beautiful building. They have a tasty cafe inside too.

name: Pagoda
address: 6th St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: Really interesting venue. Came here for a fundraiser and was able to sit in the Pagoda seats. Has a really great view of the track from the terraces.
beautiful glass structure on the inside of the start/finish stretch of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway (IMS)
Wonderful and exciting. Fast cars & beautiful weather

Maybe the best place to watch the race. Air conditioning and a great view of the start and finish line. Come watch the race from every place but you'll find the pagoda as the most comfortable. You can go up on the roof of the Pagoda and see most of the track. Or you can stay in one of the Suites and watch the race on the TV with food and beverage. We had ice cream sandwiches and walking tacos in our suite. Very clean restroom.
Awesome experience.

name: Simon Skjodt International Orangutan Center
address: 1200 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: It was exciting watching the babies play while the adults get settled down for a nap.  Orangutans are very intelligent and the caretakers provided alot of information about their care
The orangutans are very playful and are able to come right up to the glass, with plenty of room to move around and interact.

The orangutan seem comfortable and they have plenty of places to go if they want to be alone. I think that is what's most important. They like to show off for young kids sometimes which keeps visitors entertained. Love visiting.
The viewing exhibit is excellent. There are many angles to see the orangutans. You can also see them climbing inside and outside. Great exhibit Indy Zoo!

Our granddaughters loved this place!! They couldn't believe that he wanted to see the security guards arm.. to see her tatoos. My son, held out his arm and the big guy just looked up & down my sons arms at the tattoos. Then, he saw my wrist one and pointed to it, i showed him. Im in awe

name: Circle Of Lights
address: Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Fantastic and stunning...go on a cloudy or misty evening for more dramatic photos and overall experience. Really a wonderful holiday tradition.  A beautiful must see!
We stayed by the circle for the night and had no idea that City of Lights was even a thing. We were pleasantly surprised to be walking around when the light show started. It is very cool.
The best place to bring friends & family & have a good time. Coming here in December is the best time of the year.
So many people but it's enjoyable. A nice tribute to veterans. Various groups singing and dancing on stage

The tree was absolutely stunning, as always! This is a great attraction to take the whole family to see. You can just drive around the circle a couple times or park and walk around it. There is a wonderful place to get hot chocolate and snacks, Starbucks is also right there. Overall wonderful time!

name: 9/11 Memorial
address: 421 W Ohio St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Great place for to remember those who gave life for others. I lost one of my friends on this day in Trade Center One in 2001, so this memorial is a very special place in Indianapolis to me. At this day, they are trying raise additional funds for an extension of this memorial. Go to the website for this memorial for more information if interested. Take time to stop by and see this place. I think you will go away a greater appreciation for 9/11/2001
Unforgettable memories. On great place Canal Walk.

I happened upon this memorial while walking the canal. It is a very well done tribute to 911 and the World Trade Center. The beam that the eagle is on as well as the others are actual beams from the World Trade Center.
I'm a Navy veteran, I was in during Persian Gulf war and seeing this was very emotional for me. Living in Indy and knowing I can go see this whenever I want is wonderful.
Indianapolis was very smart to do this.  To remember why we are America.   Thank you

name: The Indianapolis Cultural Trail
address: 132 W Walnut St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
Thanks to all who are supporting the Cultural Trail. Thanks for helping to beautify Indianapolis and for bringing together all of Downtown's points of interest for visitors and residents.

And to all of the crew and staff who maintain and expand the Trail and The Bikes, your efforts are priceless. THANKS❗
Best trail in the Midwest!
Great opportunity to walk
Such an amazing asset for the city
Great streetscapes. Lovely sights. I wish there were signs explaining what buidlings we were looking at.

name: Zip City Indy
address: 6650 Bluff Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46217, USA
reviews:
Wonderful Family Place..!
All options are great!
Associates need a little bit more training on be more friendly...
Just a few were really helpful with information and attention.
They need to take care more about the food area....wasn't really clean and the person that was taking orders was acting as a dummy ( I'm not going to say details).
 about the price it's not too bad but I guess it could be a little bit cheaper.... main thing for families
that have more than 2 children .
After all I guess it's a great place!
We had a great  birthday party  here. Busy but not too busy. Well staffed. And the kids used all of the energy they had in only 2 hours.
This is a great place to being your family for fun. They have a wide range of things to do from ziplining to rock climbing. I highly recommend this place for parties and group events.

Good prices and fun times for all. Zip lines, climbing wall, obstacle course, laser tag,and plenty of trampolines for dodge ball, basketball, foam pits, or just general jumping around.   Vending machines are cash only, but there is a snack bar that accepts cards. No special footwear required.  There is a lounge area with couches, chairs, and tvs for parents to hang out while the little ones play.
So much fun! Lots of activities here, and great for kids. But I saw some adults hitting the zip line too, which was cool. Definitely worth checking out!

name: The Waterpark
address: 1195 Central Park Dr W, Carmel, IN 46032, USA
reviews: It's summer,  it's warm,  and everyone wants to partake in the great pastime of cooling off. This is one place you can go and enjoy every variety of water park entertainment.  There is the lazy river for the ones who want to relax but stay cool.  There is the water ski for the more adventurous. There are tons of slides to take your pick from. And of course there is the pool.  Life guards are available throughout the center. The concession stand serves up a mean ice cream cone along with other consumable items from hot dogs to pizza and of course items to quench your thirst.  Plenty of seating and lounging chairs.  Cabanas are available to rent and come with a fan,  refrigerator,  and music. People of all ages and backgrounds just enjoying the awesomeness of this nice adventure.

Had a blast! 

Highly recommend reserving a cabana in advance and purchasing entry tickets in advance online. Saves time from standing in line to get tickets. The cabana really helped with getting out of the sun and having a place to eat/relax. 

The FloRider was super fun. All of the attractions were great - slides, lazy river, rock climb wall.

The staff was over the top outstanding and nice. Hats off to all of them. They made the entire experience that much more amazing. Thank you!!!
The water park activities are fun. Love the lazy river. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Several restaurants nearby that serve good food. Overall, will recommend.
My 6yr old twins love this place. Its a fun place to spend a hot summer day.
Great place for kids of all ages!!

name: Military Park
address: 601 West New York Street, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: LOVED THE IRISH FEST!  High Kings are now one of my FAVS and in my play list!  Food was delicious and I was really impressed with kid's area.  Just an outstanding job!  Loved the good and healthy family feel of the festival.  My youngest loves to dance and I really appreciated she was able to express herself with all of the kids during the concert front stage!

I love when the pride festival is going on just wanna  break out and dance when I hear the club music playing  also they always have cool things to buy. they had best bartenders last year keep it up and imma end up making it a thing  going to the festival for the good booze hot boys and good music hell of a good time
I work all kind of events here! Huge open space, its great.

Great looking canal walk with two good restaurants and museums. Several Bridges with paintings covering the supports. Gondola rides and a military memorial. Though I give 5 stars because I enjoyed the scenery... I'd only give 2 because of the patrons. Inconsiderate people on bikes, scooters, those powered 1 wheel things, and all others will plague your otherwise serene walk. It was designed to be a walking path but you will be hounded by a-holes trying to push through the whole time. My advice is go on a weekday and/or later in the evening to avoid the majority of them. To those of you who use those modes of transportation... You obviously don't understand the way to enjoy these kinds of parks and are ruining it for everyone else.
Ride my Bicycle thru-out the park. Always something going on there, gets your gauge of what happenin' n' downtown Indianapolis.

name: Holliday Park Nature Center
address: 6363 Spring Mill Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46260, USA
reviews: Super modern, bright, and colorful. Really well taken care of. Plenty of stuff to do for a solo adventurer, but best I’ll bet when you bring your kiddo along!

We LOVE Holliday park! They have a lot to offer. We have two young girls and they really enjoy the nature center. There are critters native to Indiana, a bee hive, and fun areas to play in while learning about nature.

We usually end up going on a little hike each time we go; the trails are easy for little ones (we've done it since they have been two.. easier since three. There are stairs on some trails). Great view of the river and one spot is perfect for splashing around in your feet. 

The playgrounds are great! There are three separate areas next to each other, so you'll be able to find the perfect fit for your kiddos. 

Grounds are beautiful. Can you tell I love this park? 😊
Nice parks to spend 2 hours, make sure you do a trail going to the whiteriver. It is a short trail but had a nice scenery.
Great place to bring younger kids indoors out of the rain! My oldest is 6 and he still finds things to do. There are lots of building toys, books and a water area to play at.
Good park close to downtown. Decent amount of parking around park and playground area. Have hiking trails through a valley. Good time to loose yourself near the heart of broad ripple

name: Broad Ripple Park
address: 1500 Broad Ripple Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46220, USA
reviews:
Great park! Very dog friendly. If you have a pass for the bark park, your money is well spent. Well stocked with bags for “accidents” and I’d say about 90% of the other owners are great about cleaning up after their pups.
Day passes are available. Most members will adhere to the policy of not letting non-members in.

Always been there from my childhood when my Mother took me and my siblings to play to now. It is still clean, safe, family friendly. Beautiful huge trees, vista views of the river. You won't be disappointed!

We LOVE broad ripple park. It's a nice to place to walk and we enjoy the wooded trails. The dog park is also a great place to go with our two dogs. We haven't met any overly aggressive dogs at this park.
Small park for kids to play, large dog park and lots of walking area around the white River. There is also a boat ramp there with a decent amount of parking. Nice dock to do some fishing off of.
Pool, park, festivals are commonplace, lots of fun to be had here.

name: Depew Memorial Fountain
address: Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Definitely my favorite spot to chill downtown. Such a gorgeous fountain.
@mananhisbestfriend loves this spot... Swims and walks... Follow us!!
A nice spot to read for a while or enjoy some carry out lunch. Plenty of benches and shaded spots. Easy to get to using all of the downtown IndyGo routes.
Pretty & the only water fountain working at the moment. They shut down the others for the season, back on in the spring
My 3 year old just love's water, so we usually start our walks in the downtown area here. A real peaceful place.

name: Saint John the Evangelist
address: 126 W Georgia St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Father Rick gives great homilies and he does well creating a connection to everyday life.  He has done a great job of engaging the young adult community.  It is a great historical and beautiful church.
Gorgeous! Oldest church in Indianapolis. I was only there for a Christmas concert, but beautiful!
Wow 10am mass was filled with children, young adults. 100s  Was a beautiful lift to a visitor who attends an older parish. Dr. Rick delivered a spiritual homily.
A great place for spiritual relaxation. Love its rich history too.
Passing by for a conference and stopped in. They were so kind and welcoming to visitors!

name: K1 Speed - Indoor Go Karts, Corporate Event Venue, Team Building Activities
address: 9998 E 121st St, Fishers, IN 46037, USA
reviews:
Nice evening with the kids on our first visit. The facility is clean and well maintained. The racing area is not air conditioned, but was not too hot on a warm afternoon. The main area, with comfortable places to sit and relax, is air conditioned. It looked like there are a few rooms to revert for parties or team building exercises. I enjoyed the racing memorabilia and many pictures of past Indy 500 winners. The facility has food, a pool table, air hockey, and a couple video games. 

Very fun when it was just me and a few of my kids in the track.

We had a great time here.  Clean, fun environment.  Kids had a blast.  The top speed of the carts is controlled by the staff.  They kept it slow for the first few laps until our kids got the hang of it, then they turned it up a little bit.  I would say this is a real workout for the forearms!  If we’re in the area again we will definitely visit.

Great place and great experience! the building is in great condition and granted, the karts are all electric it is nice to not have the smell of gas burning your nostrils. Still quick little buggies and the prices have cool swag grabs, i got 3 races and a t-shirt for me and my girlfriend for under$120. Got a great memory and a cool shirt

Nice, clean place.  Air conditioned in the main area. Not in the racing area.  They have a pool table, air hockey table, and some video games.  There are areas to sit and hang out and two nice party rooms to rent out.  The whole place is decked out with Indy 500 race deco.  It's pretty cool!
Great place good for beginners since it's soo quiet with electric carts!

name: Central Canal
address: Canal Walk, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Always love to walk the canal.  Great place to think, relax, take photos, walk (and if so inclined, bike, jog, paddle boat, kayak, gondola ride, etc.).
Great place to sit and relax
Very cool place and a great still for people traveling through.
Nice place for a walk 👍
Beautiful place

name: Kurt Vonnegut Museum and Library
address: 543 Indiana Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: If you get a chance to visit and are at all familiar with the works of Vonnegut, I highly recommend a stop to this museum.  It is worth getting a tour from Max if he is available.  We got so much more out of the experience with his first hand knowledge.
What a great experience. You can get a very informative tour with the price of admission. So much is packed in this place I highly recommend it
Small but beautiful and intense little library and museum dedicated to Kurt Vonnegut and modest but fun selection of goods in their gift area for Vonnegut fans

New museum so it’s not totally built-out. Some areas are in-process. Still a very nice museum!  The curator took us around for a good 30 minutes, regailing us with KV stories!  Learned a lot.  Had an enjoyable two hour visit. Bought a few items from their little KV store and took off.
The website for the museum should issue a disclaimer that this really isn't a museum for Vonnegut, but rather an artist-in-resident forum.

name: Eagle Creek Park Beach
address: 7602 Eagle Beach Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Great facility for hosting the NCAA WOMENS NATIONAL ROWING CHAMPIONSHIPS.  Thanks to the dedicated volunteers and staff, this was another great venue!
Pretty small space for swimming and not a lot of sand either. It has a nice park and picnic area right outside the fence and smaller park inside
Family friendly beach on Eagle Creek reservoir.  Has shallow wading area and play features.  Also has changing rooms and cold showers.

Love being outdoors!
We went fishing by the beach.

Giving a 1 star review because it is physically impossible to give no stars. Swim area is tiny, goose feces everywhere, there is no sand beach, admission is expensive, everybody must take a swim test, and even after passing said test everyone must wear life vests (including adults). Do not waste your money here. The government cannot run anything properly; spend your money at a private establishment instead.

name: Museum of Miniature Houses and Other Collections
address: 111 E Main St, Carmel, IN 46032, USA
reviews: Excellent place to visit.  This is art in miniture form. Dorothy Stickles work is exceptional. The attention to detail is phenomenal. Worth a visit.
Very cool place if you are into the miniature houses.  Was a bit pricey which is why only 4 stars.
Nice variety of eras and styles of miniature doll houses. The museum is packed full of very detailed items that are worthy of being considered pieces of art.

What a fun place! If you like miniatures or maybe just looking for something different this is the place to go. Very friendly staff and it sits at the beginning of Main Street so you can start your tour there. They have a website with hours and admission prices.
Very nice place. Kids really enjoyed it.

name: Marott Park
address: 7350 N College Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews:
Went here for a short walk to kill some time before my flight - wish I had had more time to walk more! 
It was very peaceful - not many people, just a few and most had dogs. The paths are small/narrow so my friend and I walked single file for the most part.  We did have trouble navigating - finding paths that would go through and not be a dead end. Lovely Park, go check it out!
Did not get to stay long. Was pleasantly surprised with the space. Lovely hiking/ walking area.
Marrott is a great little park with water access.  Many dog lovers can be found hiking with their furry friends here.
Nice place for a short run or walk with hills, flat trails, and woods everywhere! Dog friendly, too! The river/creek adds a nice touch, too.

This place is amazing!!! Most everyone has dogs and it is a great place for the dogs to get some energy out and for the family to get some exercise. It is huge and the creek is awesome to go hang out when it's warm!

name: Southwestway Park
address: 8400 Mann Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46221, USA
reviews: It's an Indy park. I'd love to see them update a lot of the parks. Was busy this day, but that's to be expected. Still had a great time.

The park is absolutely beautiful, the problem is however, mountain bikers. It's a very popular place for them and although most are respectful, there are a few who ride dangerously, and on paths clearly marked "no bicycles". More than once we've walked our small dogs here and have almost been hit by these people. They look at you rudely as they whizz by you like you're the cause of the problem. Absolutely ridiculous.....
Love the place. Great for technically a city park. Also it only seems like there's more to it each time you go.
I was VERY impressed with the trail system here! A gem of a park, fun for many uses.

One of my favorite parks around Indianapolis. Doesn't look like much when you pull up but there's so much to explore once you venture on the winding trails. Not just a flat trail either, lots of changes in elevation and a river running through. It has a sizable playground next to the parking lot. This park is near us and they have a great recycling set up, so we bring our recycling here as well.

name: Haunted Angelus House
address: 8829 E Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46219, USA
reviews: Pay for the fast pass, while they move the line quickly, it was 15 minutes in the fast pass lane.  The actors were good, and they really tried to get some jumps out of you.  The 3D part was pretty neat and very good.  I would recommend for everyone even little kids 10 and above.

The best haunted house I've been to ever and I've been to alot, im 54 years old, and this was the most respected, very well priced, the most scariesty, and 45 mins. of pure fun! Well worth every penny!
We had a great time. Workers were nice and scary.  They kept us entertained . The kids loved the clowns. Props were cool and they loved the 3d that was new this year. We will be back

This is my second year going and it was awesome. The staff were amazing and very aware of situations. My friends and I were being bothered by a guy and his group who were waiting in line behind us and even tried to weasel his way into going in with our group. The hostess noticed it and gave us extra time to go through so guy and his friends wouldn't bother us. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
This was by far the best haunted house I have ever been to! Def wear the touch me bracelet. It was detailed and the actors really get into it. Great job!!!!

name: Hindu Temple of Central Indiana
address: 3350 N German Church Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46235, USA
reviews: This is a very beautiful Temple. All of the statues are hand made, inside and outside of the temple. I have never seen so much beautiful pieces of work in my life. Every piece of each statutes inside, outside, on the walls, gods, roof, are hand made by individuals from India. I was told that it a group of individuals who traveled from India and lived in the basement of temple a few years to hand make each piece in the temple. Each piece was made to perfection.  If you are ever invited  to visit this temple, I can promise you will not be disappointed.

Very beautiful, clean and well managed temple. People of all religions, gender and race are welcome. It's usually a quiet place but gets very crowded on certain festive days.
Even one time visitors would appreciate the architecture and get some insight into Hindu culture.
Huge temple with detailed wood work. The ambience is soothing and engaging. Went there on temple fest the food was fresh, homemade and cheap. Must visit. Plenty of parking space.
Very big temple with good cafeteria facility. Nice place to visit for praying.

I come to this temple from Louisville especially for Lord Shiva. That divine attracts you towards him. 
Jai Bholenath

name: Indiana Historical Society
address: 450 W Ohio St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Visted to see the You are there series on Madame Walker. but also saw the one on Angel Mounds.   They are fantastic.   The actors that play that play the people could get an academy award.   They stay in character and represent the people they are playing so well.   I really start thinking I am talking to the people.    I did a bit of research on Madame Walker before I went and had some things I was curious about.   In asking the question have to remember they will pretty much only respond to what happened in 1915 and prior.    There are also guides who can help you with questions after the time frame.    Every one of the You Are There series I have seen has been excellent.

I went to see their 92 different themed Christmas trees and really enjoyed myself.  The staff who played the role in the exhibit with the preacher did a great job!  He was pretty versed on religion as well as Indiana history. We were also given a little lesson on how they preserve old Indiana manuscripts-fairly fascinating.
Was a enjoyable experience.  The trees were amazing and so beautiful. Was with a group and a first time for several. Would highly recommend tickets very reasonable. Friendly staff.

Such a fun museum! In addition to a great downtown local along the canal, the exhibits themselves were awesome! I’ve never been to a museum with so much “live” interaction. The concept of time machines to transport you back to a space in time was as much fun for the adults and it was for children. The actors were very knowledgeable on anything you could thing to ask them. The architecture of the building is also very special. It has strong character but immediately, you feel like all ages are welcome and encouraged to “play”.

This place does such an amazing job with really making you feel like you're in the middle of a historical moment with their "You Are There" series. They also have a lovely illustration on how conservation is done most effectively. The historical context in exhibits and the curation are top-notch. The programming is great and the staff knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Indiana Statehouse
address: 200 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
Highly recommend doing a tour! Are 9 and 11 year old daughters had a great time and learned a lot about the different branches of government in Indiana history. The architecture is absolutely stunning and we got to see where the different laws get passed. Great family experience and the tour guide kept it interesting for our daughters.

Indiana has the longest running Supreme Court building in the country... 130 years

This is another architectural landmark in the USA.  This beautiful building is the Indiana State Capitol or the Statehouse located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis.  This 4 floor building was built in 1888 and houses all executive offices, the Indiana State Senate, the Indiana House of Representatives, and the Indiana State Supreme Court.  

About almost 100 years after it was built, the building went through a major renovation in 1986 for the Centennial Celebration two years later in an effort to restoring or recreating the original design.  "Four acres of plaster walls and ceilings were stripped, painted, and decorated.  1,500 gallons of paint were used. 124,500 square feet of interior marble and limestone were cleaned. 4.25 acres of Indiana limestone were cleaned on the exterior of the building.  31.5 miles of mortar joints were cut and repointed on the exterior limestone. 2,920 two-feet-square pieces of marble floor, approximately 1.1 miles in length, were removed and replaced for the installation of new electrical wiring. 45,000 board feet of white oak were used in woodwork, equivalent to 85 average trees. This included eight sets of white oak monumental entrance doors. 40 original brass chandeliers were restored and 67 were replicated.
Majestic architecture, historic downtown setting.

Happy to have taken the time to stop by here. What better thing to do than to learn about the history of the city you're vacationing in? This was really breath-taking, I'm not surprised there's over thousands of pictures of this pleasantly-aesthetic building.
