Surprisingly spent most of our time here in their library section where law books as well as anything historic were available for public use. The lady who worked there was so kind as to tell us a bit of history. Interesting fact: Only the chandelier lights on the fourth floor were authentic, while the rest are re-mastered replicates!
I loved this place and they are so nice!!!

name: James Whitcomb Riley Museum and Historical Marker
address: 528 Lockerbie St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: This was the perfect venue for our small wedding (60 guests). We appreciated the incredible customer service, beautiful and historic location, adaptable venue in the carriage house-style Visitor Center, and we even got to make use of the patio and lawn for our guests. The location, in walking distance of the Mass Ave. shopping and entertainment district, is also a plus.

Beautiful quaint museum which has all of its original furnishings still present. This is an unique experience. Most of the bedrooms have their own sinks.  One of the first bathrooms in Indianapolis was installed here with cherrywood copper tub wall to wall carpeting.
Really neat house. Check the walls closely that is NOT wallpaper! Unbelievable workmanship.

These people are here to take care of people, they do a great job. 
Thank you so much.
The best Victorian period furnishings and tour guides were very knowledgeable. I will definitely be back !

name: Holcomb Gardens
address: Garden Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46208, USA
reviews:
Holcomb Gardens are getting nicer and prettier as the years come along. 

The city just added some very nice new bike and running paths that extend all the way inside Holcomb Gardens.

The canal tow path is right there also and one of my fellow running pals calls the tow path a runners nirvana.
Lovely place for a walk or to relax.

This is a beautiful gem located on the Butler Campus. It's a great spot for picnics, wedding and other photo ops, dates, and solitude. There are many plants and sculptures to see. Some of the sculptures have quotes and historical information on them. It is a fascinating place to spend some time with yourself, your friends, or your family. If you play any of the Niantic driven roaming games, they have several sites located in the park.
I enjoyed the calm atmosphere. Peaceful place to walk.
I would highly recommend taking a walk and relaxing here

name: Eugene and Marilyn Glick Indiana History Center
address: 450 W Ohio St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Reasonable admittance price, friendly and helpful staff, and a variety of exhibits. The staff provided information on the exhibits before you enter and are more than willing to answer questions. Cool to see the room where they restore old documents.
Not sure what I expected but the museum underwhelmed me. Yet, the women portraying Madam C.J. Walker was outstanding in representing this important historic figure.
A good local history museum with interactive exhibits. Step through the portals into the past and "meet" figures from Indiana's history. Great for kids and smaller groups.

Having come from the South before moving to Indiana, I admire the fact that Hoosiers have a great appreciation for history. This place is representative of that. The museum's galleries do change and they uses digital technologies. The staff is pretty friendly and approachable (well...most).  Also, if you're a researcher like me, the archives holds a vast amount of archival materials.
Attending Foster Grandparents Annual Banquet with Tribute to The Temptations

name: Landmark for Peace Memorial
address: 1702 Broadway Ave., Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: I am proud of the legacy represented by Martin Luther King, Jr. And I am glad to live in a city where even on a frigid cold day people were spontaneously gathering at this memorial in Indianapolis testifying to the power of the greatest dream of all!

A historical landmark in one place that did not erupt after the assination of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. due to 1968 Presidential candidate Robert Kennedy's empathic presence and calming words in Indianapolis.
Very historical read reading of what went on there.  Amaying Robert Kennedy gave one of the best speachs ever there.  Very peaceful
Beautiful park with a beautiful piece of art.
The park is a great tribute to two great men.  Visiting reminds us of their values and the their loss.  It's a good place to talk to your kids about civil rights and civility.

name: Town Run Trail Park
address: 5325 E 96th St, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews: The park is designed for mountain bikes and is well maintained. I'm a runner and come here because it is the only natural surface trails in or near Carmel. The winding of the trails are annoying at times though I'm sure it's fun for mountain bikers. Thus for runners it's not the most fun. The portion of the park south of I-465 is a beautiful restored prairie. North of I-465 is riparian habitat and full of invasive honeysuckle though in fall a lot of the nettle flowers and captures a certain charm.
Great place to get warmed up.....! The first8 miles ended too soon! I will definitely be back!!

Took my dog for a hike here, trails are very well maintained. This trail is right by the interstate but once you get a few minutes in all you hear are the birds chirping. We went early and only saw a couple cyclist.

For not having many other places to ride, this park is pretty nice.
Some teenagers decided to modify the trail in a couple spots - but it wasn't anything wild. The maintenance crew will probably fix it, but hey when I was their age we were building pretty elaborate stuff, too.
It's nice. Probably gets pretty muddy and they don't want you riding in that, but I understand.
Anything by the White River is great, but this place is a true gem.  I only got to walk a bit of it, but I am bringing my bike to explore some more for sure next time.

name: Ellenberger Park
address: 5301 East St Clair Street, Indianapolis, IN 46219, USA
reviews: This is a wonderful park for all ages. It has multiple playgrounds and a nice walking trail.

All great but the Garden Club ruins the atmosphere by giving the ok to drive all over the park and use it for a parking lot. Food trucks every week under trees and damaging roots! There is a parking lot and Football field meant for high use. Really Rude. Disrespectful to the nature areas and the adjacent neighbors.
Cool park. Could use a bit more playground fun stuff. Decent place for a walk.
I wish there was more to do. But a nice park and the only one in the area.

Normally enjoy going to the park. It's always clean. Well kept. Didn't enjoy it so much today. My daughter's purse was stolen at the park today. We didn't bother calling the police because there was no need to because they'll never find it anyway. Suggest to everyone they not carry a purse with them to the park or anything of value. Was snatched right off the picnic table.

name: Bluebeard
address: 653 Virginia Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews: I've been here only twice in the past 2 years. I should visit more often when I'm in Indy! Food here is always excellent. Sure, I probably couldn't recite back everything that was in it, but it always meshes well together. Highly recommended!

One of the best dining experiences my wife and I have ever had...each time we go.  Have not had a bad dish, nor a bad cocktail at this establishment.  The atmosphere is busy, but it's a small space that gives you an excellent meal and overall experience.  Thanks for bringing high quality food, drink and service to Indy!

Their crafted cocktails were very delicious we sampled a lot of different ones while there. I had the Reverend Palmer, Buffalo Trace with lemon and angostura. A lovely sweetish version of a Manhattan. So smooth, loved it.
 I picked to eat off of the Savor Menu: Beet Salad, Rigatoni , Buttermilk Bread Pudding.
My sister and friend ate the Savor menu with the Salmon. My brother-in-law had the octopus on toast. All of the food was wonderfully crafted the flavors were delicious portion sizes just right. I really enjoyed the ingredients in the beet salad I hope they make that a part of their regular options. It took a really long time for us to get our dessert from the prefix menu. That was the only disappointing part of our experience, having to wait so long for a desert.

Great food. We had wings and a tuna sandwich. The wings were very good but I was skeptical of the tuna sandwich at a strip mall bar but let me tell you, it was EXCELLENT. The bartender was nice and had good customer service skills. It's a fun place with lots of locals. Great place for a rainy evening after we finished shopping.
Great place! Food was great and innovative. Service was very attentive! Definitely a must-go when in Indy.

name: Tinker Street
address: 402 E 16th St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews:
Another Indy Gem!

What a great experience. From the select list of local cocktails to an exceptional menu which is served with almost flawless service and attention.

Even though we did not have a reservation, after a decent wait, we were seated with typical charming mid-western hospitality.

The Pork Belly was truly exceptional. But please don't get this is you are not into very bold, very rich, intense flavors. If you are into this, then this is executed to perfection.

This is definitely a cozy place with some tight quarters but well worth it. 

Will definitely be going back to try other items on the menu.

Excellent place for a variety of fresh food. Delicious seasonal cocktails. The hamburger and pork belly are appropriately portioned and flavorful. Dishes are great for sharing so you can try many things. It is fairly small so make reservations. Wait staff is attentive and welcoming.

Amazing food and service! We especially loved the raw oyster appetizer, pork belly entree, and monkey bread dessert. The mignonette on the oysters was perfectly balanced. The pork belly was crispy, slightly spicy, and full of umami flavor. The monkey bread was buttery and sweet with a cinnamon flavor. Our server was attentive and had several suggestions since it was our first time dining there.

The only dish we didn’t absolutely love was the chicken and caviar. The hoecake was a bit dry and could’ve used some more sauce. The caviar seemed like an afterthought and the flavor of it was overpowered by the fried chicken. That being said, the fried chicken itself was AMAZING. Crunchy on the outside, moist on the inside...one of the best pieces of fried chicken thighs I’ve had. We’ll definitely be returning!

Had an AMAZING dinner here! Loved the touch of the Tinker Toast to start off the meal. Each dish we had was delicious — we were so sad we couldn’t try dessert, too (had to make a pick up at the airport). The service was great, the food was better, and the ambiance was spot on. Even though we were seated outside, it was covered, adequately heated, and they provided a fleece blanket. Will definitely come back here when I visit again!

Love this place.  Service is always outstanding and the food is consistent and delicious.  I love the fact that you can now make reservations.  The wine list is reasonably priced compared to the lame, chain steakhouses in Indianapolis.  A complimentary shot of sparkling wine before your meal is always a plus.

name: Harry & Izzy's
address: 153 Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Great place for lunch! Go early so you won't ruin your dinner because you will have to get the shrimp cocktail and plenty of food to follow. Fantastic service and white table cloth tables for lunch. If the sliders are offered it is a great way to get a sampling of multiple tastes on one plate.  The French onion soup tastes like it should when served by a kitchen that has great beef available for the stock. Served in a crock with plenty of crusty topped cheese. Beginning to end a wonderful experience for all your senses.

We love Harry & Izzy's because even though the atmosphere is laid back, the service is still "high end" thanks to polite, friendly, capable, uniformed staff.  The location is easy to get to.  Easily find your own parking or use the valet.  And the food is friggin' delicious.  I could eat nothing but the slab bacon appetizer and be perfectly happy.  Harry & Izzy's has become our anniversary tradition every September.  The kids love it just as much as my wife and I do.

An Indianapolis institution.  Try your best to get a meal in here during any trip to the city, and always (always!) start off with a Shrimp cocktail. If you have any eaters who don't enjoy a weighty hunk of beef, the non-steak options here, such as the prime rib pizza, are also great.

Absolutely divine. Cannot wait to go back again. It can get a little loud, but the atmosphere is so eclectic and it makes you feel as if you've gone back in time! The service and staff are so kind and welcoming and extremely helpful when you can't decide what goodness to eat! Absolute treat.

Harry & Izzy's is a wonderful spot. My boyfriend and I brought our families here for them to meet each other and they gave us a private room without evening having to ask. We had the best time and the servers were outstanding. The lunch special steak sliders were delicious. We'll be back.

name: St. Elmo Steak House
address: 127 Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at St. Elmo’s. We went on a Sunday when they had a special Sunday evening meal. I enjoyed the trout with crab on top and my husband enjoyed the steak. He said they may be the best steak he had tasted! Our server, Calvin, was superb. The food was perfectly flavorful and we both left feeling full. We were both happy with our wine and the wine selection is amazing. We made reservations and enjoyed the ease of coming in with our table ready for us.

Step back in time to an old school high end steak house. The service is amazing. The steaks are fantastic too. But the star is the famous shrimp cocktail with ho.e made sauce. They fresh grind fresh horse radish daily and the kick of heat from the sauce will make you tear up. A must try if you are in Indy!

Very expensive. 

Steak was tender but dry and had no flavor. My wife's chicken was very good. 

The steak was not worth the $60 a person in my opinion. Jumbo shrimp and cocktail sauce was good but again $2 per piece of shrimp was too high priced for my taste buds.

Nice atmosphere, very clean, quick friendly service, wait staff in tuxedos when we walked in should have been my clue it was going to be way more than I would typically spend.

There are a lot of great steak houses in this world but St. Elmo is definitely one of them. Wonderful food in a wonderful atmosphere served by professionals is always a winning combination. I always get a shrimp cocktail to clean my sinuses before enjoying the veal chop with grilled onions.  Have never had a bad experience or regret over how much I spent which is always a lot!

Good steak house but I've had better. Got the new York strip steak and its not as tender as I'm used to. Just it was still very good and cooked perfectly (I ordered medium). The famous shrimp cocktail is VERY heavy on the horseradish so be ready for that. Ordered the black berry Moscow mule, not enough ginger beer but still pretty good.

name: Nada
address: 11 W Maryland St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
My husband and I visited Indy for the first time and our hotel recommend Nada but under sold it as just a taco place. I'm glad we went for it! We ordered the chips and salsa trio which includes mild, medium and spicy salsas. I'm not typically a spicy salsa girl but this was one of the best salsas I've ever tried. I'm still trying to figure out if I can replicate it at home. 

For the entrees, I ordered the braised chicken enchiladas. I loved the presentation in the cast iron skillet and the surprise of couscous. It had the right amount of heat and creaminess. My husband orders steak fajitas at every Mexican restaurant we visit. The beef was tender and full of flavor. His only complaint was he wanted more of the poblano peppers and less liquid in the skillet. Although he would have preferred flour tortillas (there were out at 8 pm on a Sunday, totally understandable), the corn tortilla were the perfect size and tasted great.

Nada is a small upbeat downtown Mexican restaurant.  It serves authentic dishes in just the right portion with aesthetic presentation. The ambiance is contemporary  yet has a definite south of the border vibe. The wait staff although young, were efficient and accommodating. We were served promptly and the food was delicious.  Everyone was a fan of the homemade guacamole which we eagerly shared with the freshly made corn tortilla chips. My grandson recommended it, and we all liked it well enough that we plan to return. There is free on the street parking, although you may have to circle the block a time or two. Try it, you will agree, their food is on point!

Food was incredible. Get the pork belly tacos, you won’t regret it. Everything we tried was delicious, including the dessert. Ambiance was lovely- great place for a date, though we went as a family to meet up with an in-town relative. Manager Steve was attentive and kind. Would definitely go again!

Have been here twice and the food has been great both times. Very cool environment, staff is pretty friendly. Pastor tacos are excellent as well as the Asian tacos (forget the name). My wife had a salad that she loved but the plate it came on was way way too small. Very awkward to eat. Otherwise, love this place.

Very pleased with service and meal. I wasn’t quite sure about cuisine but was pleasantly surprised. I had the steak fajita and was the best I’ve ever had. I’m not a fan of beans but theirs was very good. Thank you for a great experience!

name: Mama Carolla's
address: 1031 E 54th St, Indianapolis, IN 46220, USA
reviews:
// A wonderful local business that needs your support during this time! They are open for carry out 7days a week until 8pm and have A perfect pickup system in place. 

The food is amazing as always. They still offer their full menu AND you can get wine/beer to go! Perfect for if you’re wanting to do a quarantine date night. They wrapped the food so it wouldn’t spill in the car and stayed warm. They do deliver in the Broad Ripple Area as well.

My boyfriend took me here for Valentines dinner. I had never tried this restaurant before and was so excited when I found out we were going here. The waiters were so friendly and checked in on us frequently enough that I never had my drink empty. The wine was delicious and the food was amazing! Definitely will be coming back here for another special occasion.

Really disappointed. We were recommended MC’s multiple times and were so excited to try it. Just got a carry out order of Chicken Lasagna, Buffalo Mozzarella, and eggplant spaghetti(can’t remember the name). None of it tasted good. $54 later and we didn’t finish any of it. Really really bummed out because I was so excited for this after all of the great reviews. Even the salad was watery. Currently eating cereal. I wanted this to be our Italian spot!

There's a reason this place is busy throughout the week. The food is delicious and the place is lovely. It's also much bigger than I thought and it was still packed. Great spot for special occasion dinners. The food does take time though so make sure you get an appetizer so you're not famished by the time your mains arrive.

Was recommended by a friend after searching high and low for some edible Italian food in Indianapolis.  Lo and behold, it does exist!  Most of the other places can't even cook proper spaghetti and Mama Carolla's can compete with the best of them in New York.  They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait, but it is so worth it (and you'll be salivating by the time they seat you, the smells are so good).  I had the manicotti and my dad had the chicken picatta.  I'm always a pasta person, and I wish I'd gotten the chicken, so tender and lemony it was.  And the building itself is so charming and feels like it could be in the Italian countryside if you don't look too closely.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: 45 S Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
Um our waiter saved the night because he was awesome!!!!!!!!!! However I was not really impressed with the steak and lobster... to be honest me and my wife loved the crab cake and bread better than everything else. That's why I thought it was a bad!! Then to not mention we was pushed to a terrible seating and we was not happy but we rolled with it. But I think for $200... I could have went to a better place for better food. But our waiter and his helper helped us stay. I really hate to leave this 
Post but for spending that kind of money I expected better food not mention we wanted porterhouse for 2 and they was out. Come one they should have known.

Amazing experience. From the waiters to the manager who would occasionally check in and the kitchen staff, everything went wonderfully. The Lobster Mac and cheese is awesome and it's so much it feed a table of three. And the cheesecake was amazing as well. All in All 10/10. Can't wait for next time

Lined their pockets with $20 million of taxpayer money intended to bail out small businesses. Shamelessly. Order quarantine takeout from someone who didn’t get that money. And also someone who is steaks aren’t as dry and bland.
Birthday Dinner was outstanding. Kendall, Justice and Victoria took care of us. I would dare say this was the complete experience- not just a meal. Enjoy

Our server Victoria made the night the best it could have been. Three of the four of us that went had never been. She fully explained everything to us and even helped us narrow down what we wanted. The food was AMAZING! The steak was so tender it almost melted in your mouth. The lobster mac and cheese was the die for!! Price was very expressive but well worth the food!(:

name: Seasons 52 - Takeout & Delivery Available
address: 8650 Keystone Crossing, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews: Expanded our culinary bubble by visiting this location for a date night and was pleasantly surprised with the results! I've never heard of Seasons 52 previously and only found it from a Google Maps suggestion. A very nice deal is the menus include "popular" item markings and rightfully so, as that's all we ordered and it was delicious. Reservations recommended to avoid sitting on an awkward waiting list.

They got us in for a dinner reservation on Valentine's day for the same night. They stayed open past their usual hours so couples could continue to enjoy themselves. The wait staff and chefs are very knowledgeable about allergies and they have some specific allergy-friendly menus. The management came by at the end and was very receptive to some ideas about allergy free desserts they could carry. The valet was incredibly pleasant and eager, even on a busy night while out in the freezing cold. All around great experience!!!

We had a larger private dining experience at Seasons 52 and they did not disappoint. We were very late but their team was so incredible! Taylor Wright was awesome to work with. She was meticulous and was super helpful in planning everything - from the menu to the invoice - everything was great. We also had 2 amazing servers - Mark and Andy. They were awesome! They took care of us and went above and beyond. They were so kind and pleasant and all the guests had great things to say about the food and the service.
Thank you Taylor, Mark and Andy!
You guys are awesome and we will be back!

We had lunch with friends yesterday and we enjoy Seasons 52 so much, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is wonderful but our service was very poor. We had a reservation and were seated on time but did not have anyone come to our table for 15 minutes. There seemed to be adequate staff but no one came to even take drink orders. Our reservation was for 1:00 pm and we didn’t get our food until 2:05. The young lady who was our waitress was very nice but I was very disappointed in the service we received.

Always excellent. Delicious Chilean Sea Bass... soft, moist, sweet... just like it should be. The Split Pea and Kale soup was a wonderful surprise. Thick full soup, great croutons with hint of olive oil flavor... perfect for the cold snowy weather!

name: Iozzo's Garden of Italy
address: 946 S Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: I had such a heart warming experience. The day before my husband and I eloped, he had the set up the perfect spot to propose to me. Everyone was so welcoming and engaged. I absolutely loved the food and service. It was PERFECT. We’ll definitely try making it here once a year, since we’re from out of town. Thank you all for helping me feel like a princess that day! 💖

This place was incredible! I wasn't sure about it based on the unassuming name, but I was very pleasantly surprised. I loved the risotto and my wife was raving over the truffle fettuccine. Pricing and portions were fine, atmosphere was calm and enjoyable. Looked like a decent beer and wine selection. We will definitely be back for a date night.

What a magical place!  Kristin is the best bartender (and if she isn't a manager, she certainly is a leader).  The stuffed mushrooms were divine, and the lasagna lived up to hype.  Try the fried ravioli!  The staff is extremely friendly and they even box up your left overs.  The home made salad dressings are amazing.  Come for dinner, a date, or a special occasion.

Absolutely LOVED this place! The atmosphere was incredible, the place was clean, and the staff were all incredibly friendly. I cannot wait to go back, and that's not even taking into account how delicious the food was. I found myself trying to decide between 3 different entrees, and the waiter (Gregory) suggested the sausage and peppers. The bread that came out was warm and delicious and the salad had the just right amount of dressing. The appetizer came out really quick and was spot on. The entree was so good I could have had it twice! 

Overall I had an incredible experience and I would love to return!

Atmosphere was great. We dined in the outdoor area. The service was outstanding.  I really enjoyed the house salad,  the toasted ravioli appetizer, and the miniature cannolis for dessert. I ordered the lasagna for my main entree, but I was not impressed  with it.  Overall it was a nice experience except for the entree.

name: Delicia
address: 5215 N College Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46220, USA
reviews: Great ambiance and really good service. The guacamole was delicious and the drinks were tasty as well. The brunch is tasty and so is dinner. Great place for groups but definitely a great date place.

One of my favorites in south broad ripple area. It has great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, and great service. I have been here to meet with friends, with kids, and on a date. It is a versatile place. I love the Fire 'n Ice, a spicy cocktail. Overall, a restaurant worth a few extra bucks. The only thing is their limited parking but you can always find street parking in this area.

I’ve been here a couple of times. The food is always tasty. Unfortunately, this last time service wasn’t that great. We sat at the bar and were practically ignored. Every time we needed something we had to wave the bartender down because he hardly checked on us. When he did, he wasn’t very friendly and when he messed up our order, he spent what I felt was too long trying to prove it was our fault instead of just making it better.
Great food. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. Attentive servers. Will definitely be coming back for date night.
Very nice restaurant with friendly staff. Food was good and the restaurant was clean. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. Great experience

name: Café Patachou
address: 225 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Tried this place based on a recommendation. It was decent. I had the chicken salad sandwich. It was good but nothing exceptional. They seem to offer a large variety of vegan and gluten free options which was important to some members of our party. They seemed to enjoy their meal as well.

I absolutely love Cafe Patachou!!! Dee-lish-us!!!!! This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants and one that I suggest often. The amount of food is reasonable for the price, and the quality is top-notch. Their ingredients are obviously high quality and make even the simple menu items taste amazing. It's just simply good! Their omelettes are flavorful and about dang near perfect. Their French toast is heavenly. And their regular cinnamon toast is questionably fantastic......like they have some of secret recipe. Even their little lightly dressed greens are wonderful! And their coffee is some of the best I've had. If I lived closer, I would eat here every day.......for multiple meals. Go out of your way for this place! Totally worth it!

I had the combination half sandwich and half soup.  I opted for the chicken salad sandwich in a croissant and the tomato artichoke soup.  For the side, I chose the chips, which were decent.  My sandwich was quite good on the croissant.  I'm glad I went with it.  My soup was a little on the salty side, but was tasty and very tomatoey, if you know what I mean.  Service was great.  I didn't wait too long for my order to arrive. My waitress was very attentive and friendly.   Also, in terms of the menu, they do have quite a selection to choose from. The normal portion sizes look filling enough as I looked at what other guests around me have ordered.  Overall, my experience was good here.  Worth a try!

My waiter was extremely nice and helpful (Dylan, not sure on the spelling). It has a perfect location of both city viewing and sitting outdoors. I had the Cuban breakfast and it was stellar. I did find out that I could add many things to it and I highly recommend adding another egg and possibly another meat, like bacon or ham. I also consumed the kids French toast meal and that was excellent (especially as a little dessert size for breakfast). The crisp on the edges of the bread was a wonderful touch. My fruit cup consisted of apple, pineapple, strawberry, and orange. The coffee was fresh and delightful. I will definitely be coming back again for at minimum, the breakfast. I can only imagine that lunch would be delectable 💕

The food was amazing, the service was fast didn’t even use all the time at the meter. My girlfriend and I really enjoyed it. The best breakfast your going to get in this area, and bang for your buck. The hot chocolate was A+. We are energized to take on the day. We will be back for sure.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
address: 117 E Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: This place is simply amazing!  I’d never had anything like it. It starts off with an amazing salad bar, but don’t get too full!  There’s a parade of people marching around with every kind of grilled meat you can think of! It’s never ending. Drinks too!  This is one of the most unique and fun places I’ve ever eaten at!  I think it’s time to come back!

Went for the first time during Devour Indy and it was amazing! Our server Shaun was outstanding and very attentive. The cuts of meat that we got were always cooked to perfection! We unfortunately didn't get to taste all the options that were available, but what we did get was outstanding. The cocktails also very well made! Definitely will be back!

Excellent food and experience.  The salad bar in itself would be a great meal.  So many  healthy items, but the table service with all of the delicious meats was my favorite.  Had reservations for 5 p.m. when they opened for dinner and was seated and eating within 15 minutes. I will definitely return!

Went here for my husband's birthday with friends and mother in law. Had great service the first 20 minutes there and was constantly asked if we had been helped and ordered. Friends showed up 25 minutes late and we were never revisited by the waitress for refills OR to ask our friends what they wanted to order and drink. An employee making drinks at a rolling bar asked us if we wanted a special drink and we said yes and also if our friends could get a water glass at the very least. They were only served the mixed drink and never brought anything else. The chips you flip over for more food were already at the table so they got to eat food but no drinks for them. Zero stars for service but 2 for the food since it actually was great. The steaks were the only  good part of it.  Sides and salsd bar were not seasoned and old.

We went for our anniversary dinner and they gave us a free dessert with happy anniversary written on it. Lovely place for a romantic dinner. 

Only wish the music would have been turned down a bit, so I could hear some of the people bringing the meat around. Still pleased with the overall experience though.

name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery
address: 40 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
Jordan provided outstanding performance, if not, The Capital Grille may have received only two stars.

The best serving was the appetizer.  A nicely done sauce but the shrimp and the bread were both over cooked and difficult to cut even with a butter knife.

The lobster bisque was average at best and lacked flavor.

The medium rare steak was more rare than medium. The lobster lacked flavor.

The cream spinach was so overly salted we sent it back.  We were told that the chef agreed that it was over salted and asked if we wanted something else.   We were puzzled that the chef didn’t taste it before it left the kitchen.

They did have a nice stirring stick that was covered with sugar crystals that was very creative.

The cream and strawberries were ok.

At the expense we probably will look elsewhere on our next trip as we were disappointed with the cuisine.  Once again, the service was fantastic but the culinary experience was lacking.

This restaurant is so good. It's definitely pricey however the service from the moment we walked in the door, to when we left was exceptional. The dessert was amazing😍. I suggest to park in the mall garage and save on valet parking, it's just a short walk. My husband and I went here for our anniversary and they set up our table with rose petals. ♥️♥️♥️ It truly made our evening special. Thanks Capitol Grille for making our night perfect.

This place is awesome. My first time visiting. At first glance at prices I thought "a little pricey". But portions were large and the food was excellent.  We also loved the Burbon.  We will visit again for sure.  Next time we must save room for dessert.  Also the restaurant was extremely clean and the ambiance was perfect.  Highly recommended!!!

Pricey. Good service and good food. Wide variety of patrons. Dress code varies but majority were nice shirt jeans some men added a blazer but not all. Call for a reservation if you want a booth. Good for date night especially if you add a staycation with attached Conrad Hilton.

This is one of the better Capital Grille’s I’ve been to. Service was outstanding and incredibly attentive. The ahi tuna was prepared to perfection. The soy glazed Brussels sprouts were also exceptional.

name: Yolk - City Way
address: 220 E South St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
Holy cow — that cinnamon roll French toast! All the sweet breakfast options I’ve tried here are truly amazing. From the nutty monkey cakes to the red velvet French toast, they’re all rich, decadent and delicious. There’s even a featured sweet cake that changes regularly. I also appreciate that you can have real maple syrup (for a charge) which is pretty rare. Sweet breakfasts are clearly their main thing.

Yet there’s still plenty of options to enjoy a healthier breakfast here. Any of the scrambles or the HUGE omelets can be made with egg whites. And there’s a great variety of veggies to add in to their dishes. 

Again, they have lots of delicious fresh juices, though they’re a bit pricey. Their regular brewed coffee is not great, though it gets the job done. 

We typically sit at the bar where we like interacting with the staff. Even when the place is very busy, they’re always friendly.

I’ve ordered from Yolk before, usually on the circle, and it is always good quality. However, with the current situation, I am ordering online and the prices are astronomical. To build your own omelet, it’s $18.50! It costs extra to add meat, it cost extra to add cheese, it cost extra to add a side of anything (fruit, potatoes, etc). Is the quality good? Yes. Is it worth spending almost $20 for an omelette? No. I decided to go with cheaper options in the city. First Watch, Wild Eggs, and Metro Diner are cheaper and just as good with more unique options.

I don’t know when I’ve had such a pleasant experience having breakfast! Everyone greeted us as we came in and showered us with attention - this is an unusual experience in Indy where customer service is not a priority. Lots of smiles. An old friend I worked with in the past 
was our server and he was wonderful: knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food. When you go, ask for James. 
And an excellent menu! Who knew there were so many ways to have breakfast? Both sweet and savory items, all of it beautifully prepared and served. Way too much food to eat in one sitting, you will want a to-go box. Worth every penny.

We ordered carry out this morning. I asked for no mushrooms in my omelette, and there were mushrooms. The entire omelette tasted like citrus which was an odd flavor to have while eating eggs. It was most likely because I also chose fruit on the side. The fruit had mold on most of the grapes. I ordered an Iced chai latte. I’ve tried to order it twice now. It seems as if they do not actually know how or do not the have the ingredients to do this because I have ended up with an Iced coffee both times. 

My recommendation is to order simple here. The food is good enough to eat, but trying to do more than eggs and bacon or just pancakes is too hard.

i came here for my birthday while out of town and I've got to say this place is amazing. the red velvet french toast was the best ive ever had. and our waiter was so good and knowledgeable. definitely going to have to try this back in FL.

name: OP Italian Indy
address: 10 S West St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Great atmosphere, great service, amazing food. Had the tomato braised lamb shank and it was so tender and delicious. My wife had the short rib gnocchi and she said it was absolutely wonderful. 10/10 would recommend for a special night
We were there for their preview night. The new menu items that we tried were phenomenal. The drinks were just as good too!

Such good food here! The chicken Caesar salad I had for lunch was awesome. Chicken was so tender! My coworkers loved the pizza. Went for dinner as well and was not disappointed. The vodka rigatoni was out of this world and my friend enjoyed the spaghetti and clams. Great service too!

Everything is fabulous. I think our table ordered about a dozen different things, and I also think we would order them all again. First courses, mains, desserts—all delicious. The lemon tres leches cake was amazing, the potato tart was a revelation, and the canelones melted in our mouths. The service was friendly and attentive. We look forward to going back!
Love this place— the Burrata is amazing and Colleen gave us the best service! Such a joy to be around and made us want to come back. Highly recommend!

name: Milktooth
address: 534 Virginia Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews: Great place for an artisan breakfast, coffee and drinks! Great menu selection with everything from bacon to vegan. Short order cook style and an atmosphere that you'd expect. Up and coming neighborhood out of downtown and worth the visit and supporting places like this! You won't be disappointed.

Generally pretty busy. Expect a wait for weekend brunch. The wait is made easy by a counter where you can order drinks and pastries. The food here is very creative and the atmosphere is pretty darn hip.  It's in a converted mechanics garage. The garage doors with glass panes form the front wall. Cool music playing, excellent vibe from the staff.

I had the sourdough waffle and it was amazing. They put a slice of salted honey butter on top that was to die for. I could eat that butter on anything. I really enjoyed the restaurant and the atmosphere. My girlfriend had a gluten free chocolate dessert that was also very good. I recommend at least checking this place out for the food alone. If I'm in the area again I'll be back.

What can I say about Milktooth besides it is the most exotic food you can find in the city. They constantly have something new, and are almost always sold out of something because of how delicious it is. Highly recommend!

I used to live in Indy and frequented Milktooth because their food is spectacular. I do not exaggerate when I say it's my favorite breakfast place of all time. I recently was back for the holidays and needed to get my fix. They still got it. Their execution on the dishes is always spot on, inventive, and balanced. It is worth the wait if know good food.

name: Bosphorus Istanbul Cafe
address: 935 S East St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews:
Small and wonderful little restaurant
 The food is amazing; we loved the Pita here. It was soft and we could finish the whole basket in couple of minutes. 
They have lots of veggie options. The ambience is also pretty neat and nicely decorated.

We have eaten about every restaurant downtown and this will be our new go to going forward! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! You will not be disappointed and the sample appetizer is a must have, also add a side of tzatziki sauce that they make fresh. We will be back every chance we get!!! Do not pass up an opportunity to eat here, it is a hidden gem in all of Indianapolis.

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is tasty and the stuff is welcoming and cooperative. Every time  we eat in this place we have a pleasant time.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

Wife asked me what I wanted to eat. Any chance I can get I choose Lamb. This time I wanted grilled. She searched and found this place. It was my first time to an Istanbul Cafe. I was skeptical after we walked in because we were asked did we have a reservation. We said no. The young lady looked at her book. It was as if she was trying to decide if she wanted us to eat there. Me recognizing the game my reaction was that we would take out. My attitude is always that people can be how they want to be. It's my choice whether or not I want to be part of it. Anyway after fumbling she found us a table close to the exit so I was able to hear if any others were entering without reservations. There were and there was no hesitation to seat them.

The waiter came forward he seemed hesitant by the look in his eyes but he was efficient. Got appetizers, came quick. Ordered humus and there were two types of egg plant appetizers we couldn't decide so he offered a half-and-half. That was awesome because he didn't have to do that. What was more awesome was the taste and the amount of dishes. So much that we asked for to go boxes. Didn't want to spoil our appetite. Right when he brought the to go boxes the entrees came. Wife had shrimp casserole and side order of spinach. My dish consisted of three medium done lamb chops with red and green bell peppers along with tomatoes. All grilled and excellent.

To end, we couldn't finish our entrees so yeah to go box was needed for my wife but I finished mine. So good we ordered entrees for each of us  and one for our son to take home. It all totalled one hundred six dollars for five entrees, two appetizers and water. Do the math. Beer and wine was available. We left a tip as we always do. Amount depends on the service and food. I can say the waiter was smiling when we left.

Moral of the story is don't judge a book by its cover.  Most of us want to leave a deserving tip but because of judgement or what you've heard you give us half-a*?! service. So we give you that type of appreciation.

The food is excellent here. I would recommend reservations on the weekend. Thet didn't really have a host taking done names in the lobby. We just waited in an amorphous line for the next group to be called. Nobody knew how long the wait would be. We ended up waiting for about 26 minutes. Not the worst but definitely confusing. Other than that the food and rest of the experience was top notch. (pictured is the appetizer combo)

name: Mimi Blue Meatballs
address: 870 Massachusetts Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Never had a bad meal here. Friendly staff that is well versed in the menu & good customer service. I prefer off hours when the crowds aren't so much, but honestly the noise pollution factor isn't the worst here even when they're busier. They manage to be a cozy place in one of the trendiest areas downtown, so chalk another point up for a nice meal. Probably the best turkey meatballs in Indy, too.

I doubt a restaurant with “meatball” in the title is the first thing that comes to mind when you hear “brunch”, but I’d invite you to challenge that assumption and switch up your normal brunch routine with Mimi. 

The pancake balls? Just the right amount of sweet, but not so much you feel guilty. Great to share. 

The biscuits and gravy is a fun nod to their typical meatball cuisine, but with a flaky biscuit and perfectly seasoned breakfast sausage instead. 

Top it off with a peach mimosa and cup of coffee and you might just have a new go-to brunch place!

I love this place. On a sunny day, grab a seat on the sidewalk. The bread for the subs is fantastically crunchy and chewy. I usually get the classic meatball with Bolognese. Make sure to get the side salad instead of the fries. Also, note to owners, double the size of the side salad that comes with the sub please :)

The sliders are either great or good but the buns are always fantastic. They are big for sliders and are definitely splittable if you want to try a few combinations!

Decent food, though the meatballs seem to have shrunk since I have been there several years ago. Our family of 4 left with a $120+ bill including a couple of adult drinks and 3 desserts. Not horribly expensive but it's not too cheap for meatballs either. The food is a bit salty (especially the sauces) so you will feel parched at the end of the night after a dinner here. Atmosphere is warm albeit a little on the noisy end. I'd prefer it quieter.

The meatball flights (I will forever call them that) are delicious! Lots of options to mix and match and the meatballs lived up to this Italian meatball stickler's expectations of how meatballs should be. Great job! Will definitely be back!

name: Oakleys Bistro
address: 1464 W 86th St, Indianapolis, IN 46260, USA
reviews: A great place for special occasions. Had a great birthday meal. Not pictured is the cheese plate we had for appetizer which was fabulous

James Beard Finalist and beating Bobby Flay.  What else does a man need?
We celebrated a special occasion here and I would recommend others to do the same.  The atmosphere relaxes you while the food borders some of the best I've had in my life.  We have been here several times now and strive to taste the entire menu.  Indianapolis is lucky to have this gem of a place!

Delicious from start to finish. The food was some of the best I’ve ever tasted, with wonderful and unique flavors and presentation. The service was top notch and the environment is incredible. One of the best spots in the Indianapolis area.

Awesome food. Great service. We ordered a lot of food here and everything tasted good. A little heavy on the salt but overall taste and flavor profile was amazing. If you go there you must order shrimp corn dogs. This restaurant's chef beat Bobby flay with this dish.
The famous shrimp corn dogs were amazing! Loved the flavors and presentation of the food. Great ambiance. Service was excellent.

name: Conner’s Kitchen + Bar
address: 350 W Maryland St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Such a nice place to eat. Food was delicious. The waitress was super friendly and the atmosphere very nice. I would definitely recommend

Genevieve answered all of our questions and had excellent menu recommendations. The food was flavorful, fast, and very fresh. Any place that asks you how you would like your salmon cooked and then delivers perfectly has a place in my heart! We had the BLT deviled eggs, grilled salmon, and ooey butter cake for dessert

Ambiance was good - could get loud when full but we had a good level of busyness without too much. We did not have drinks but they all looked good and we will be back to try!

I'll tell ya what, we were so impressed by the food, ambiance, and most importantly the courteous and genuinely helpful suggestions by Rachel L. tonight that it was worth our time to come by twice for food and drinks. Both times, Rachel L. was friendly and kind, she really made our experience an unforgettable one. 

First course of roasted Brussel sprouts was probably the most delectable way that I've ever had them cooked. So tender, so perfect, slightly sweet, punctuated by crunches of nuts. Oh so yummy! Highly recommend the sprouts.

Food was good. Pictured is smoked turkey salad (no onion). Brussels sprouts HAD fried onions on them (not discussed on the menu). I identified my gluten allergy. So they took the sprouts from the table (rather than letting other 3 people eat some) (even though I tried to stop that). They later brought out remake of the sprouts with rest of meal (after appetizers were long gone), and then still charged full price. At the end of the meal,  we had only tried 3 of the sprouts--they were obviously uneaten. Disappointed when restaurants do stuff like that.

Came here to have dinner before an IRT show. Had the BLT Deviled eggs, got portion to share with two people. Had the Cheesy Chicken Enchilada, what a great taste. Server, Genevieve, was amazing with hospitality and dinning recommendation. Would recommend to anyone in the area to give it a try and ask for Genevieve as your server. Thanks for an amazing dinner before the IRT show tonight!

name: Rook
address: 501 Virginia Ave #101, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews: I always enjoy my time at Rook. The food is well seasoned, thoughtful and delicious. The space itself is always super clean.  They have a  great bar selection, excellent location and unrivaled hip hop/ rap playlist. I recommend the dan dan noodles for dinner or the chicken karrage bowl for lunch.
For what it is, it is great. Solid friendly service. The food is heavy but delicious. The giant pork roast is so good. Even the crazy shake dessert was good. Enjoyed the meal and unique food

Service is great! 

When it comes to the food and decoration, it just doesn’t have the wow factor I was hoping for. For the price point ($20/ dinner entree), I was hoping for more a fusion of other flavor/aroma/texture/plating  than what I can get at a typical Asian restaurant. It fell short in this area.

Rook is trying, but perhaps a little too hard. The chicken thigh dish had the makings of a great southern and Asian fused dish, but unfortunately it didn’t quite come together. The breading just slipped off. The fried avocado and steamed buns were decent but nothing I’d have to have again, and then finally, the shrimp and toast was just a mix of odd flavors that didn’t mesh well. Additionally, the toast was burnt. Finally, the cocktails were pretty basic for a fusion restaurant.

I was here on a business trip with a colleague and he suggested it. All of our food was very good, our waiter was very personable and offered us suggestions when we told him we were out of town. Our service was good, and the place was clean. If I were back in town I would come again

name: High Velocity
address: 10 S West St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: 4pm Tuesday no wait, service attentive to a fault, very friendly.  Salmon BLT fresh ingredients, lightly seasoned recommend.  Sweet potato fries were crisp, everything top quality.  Pineapple Express great for summer.  Worth the price.

Came here for a light dinner prior to going across the street for an Indians Baseball game. Good food, drinks and service, nice looking clean place that offers two separate bar areas to hang out in and tv’s everywhere.

Great food and great sports atmosphere!  Comfortable seating and open floor.  Tables have adequate space to move around and not bunched up.  Really enjoy the views of town through the windows.  Ordered an order of pretzels and wings as appetizers and beef short rib sandwich and Reuben sandwich with fries as our entrees.  Great food without the pressure of eating fast.  Took in the Pack and Bears game.  I thought prices we're reasonable for a hotel located dining option.

Our Server John F is the man! Very personable person and a joy too be around! Great at his job and he runs circles around the other staff with ease!!! If i could have a server like this every meal id never eat at home again 😂. Oh yeah Food was good too 👍

My husband and I were visiting Indianapolis for a convention and stayed in a hotel adjacent to High Velocity. We walked over using the Skywalk from our hotel which was very convenient. High Velocity seated us quickly and our waiter, John, was one of the friendliest people I have ever met in the food service industry! He gave us food recommendations and was prompt with drink refills; but he also went above and beyond and found us a map of things to do in Indianapolis when we mentioned we were visiting from St. Louis. The food was excellent - worth the higher dollar amount. We shared an appetizer of pretzels with beer cheese. The pretzels were soft and fresh and the cheese had a good flavor. I had the salmon plate and subbed sweat potato fries for the rice. The salmon was some of the best salmon I've ever had; tender and flavorful. The asparagus was cooked perfectly - not overdone or mushy. The sweet potato fries were just the right flavor to go with the salmon. My husband had the chicken tenders plate with fries and he said the chicken was fresh and soft; not over-fried or rubbery. The atmosphere was pleasant, especially for a sports bar. It wasn't overly crowded or loud. There were TVs at booths that you could select your channel and volume, but there were also TVs on the walls and pillars to watch if you were placed at a table that didn't have its own TV. Overall, great experience and we would go again.

name: Late Harvest Kitchen
address: 8605 River Crossing Blvd, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews: What can I say? Intimate and cozy restaurant and bar. Our waiter was Phenomenal! Knowledgeable about the menu, excited to have us taste the food and always seemed to anticipate our next need. The food was seasoned to perfection and what a unique and delicious menu. This was a special treat. Perfect for date night, Girls night out, Anniversary or Birthday. Trust me, you cant go wrong!!

First class service and food. Had the filet minon which was prepared perfectly. Also had the calamari as an appetizer and veggies and potatoes side dishes. All of the dishes were seasoned and presented well. Our server was very attentive. Great experience and highly recommend!

My favorite is the dessert: sticky toffee pudding !! It's crazy that i'm usually not a dessert person, but this dish melts my taste bud :D. Their pork chop is the best, also complimentary bread is upon request - make sure you ask for that :) small menu but they change it often, so definitely will not get bored here. Laid back service but quality!!!
Amazing food. Chef owned and operated (so I'm told!). Seriously great food. Stop in. You won't be disappointed.
Great food, but a bit pricey hence the 4 vs. 5 stars.  Staff was attentive.  Cocktails were very good, but very pricey. Recommend the blueberry drink.

name: The Rathskeller
address: 401 E Michigan St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews:
We had an incredible experience here.

For starters, the pretzel and horseradish mustard were amazing... be aware that the horseradish is VERY intense.

The stuffed mushrooms were rich and cheesy!

The potato salad was one of the most flavorful things I've eaten in a long time!

The bacon wrapped New York strip was... bacon-wrapped - need I say more?!?

And the German chocolate cheesecake was mind-boggling delicious.

Add to this the traditional German atmosphere and you have a place that totally lives up to the hype!

Food is authentic and very good, as is the service. Our German exchange student vouched for the quality and said it was excellent.  You wont leave hungry.  I love this place! Such a unique historical building and location to dine on authentic German cuisine.

Went to watch a couple bands Hot Pockets & Jukebox Luke both were very good! You should catch them anytime they are in town! Was very impressed with the atmosphere, absolutely amazing old building. We've been on the Keto diet but found a great Greek salad on the bar menu & hard liquor with diet coke rounded out the evening! They also a have restaurant with a full menu, food looked good! Parking is the only draw back. All we found was on street parking with meters, but if you circle a time or two someone is always leaving so it doesn't take long to find a spot. Maximum walking distance 1 1/2 to 2 blocks. Well worth the trip!

The Rathskeller biergarten is THE PLACE to be on a weekend night on Mass Ave. The live music goes until 11pm and is always fun.  If you can get there early to claim an outdoor picnic table for your group that is a plus. If you don't have a table, it is still an awesome time.

This is a very nice restaurant. It's really big and sort of underground, but it's no less spectacular and beautiful. Tonight was my first time coming here and they dressed up it for Christmas. Very pretty and romantic. Now, on to the food. Firstly, I strongly warn against the spicy mustard. I thought it was some kind of butter and was very unpleasantly surprised when I tried it with the bread. It made me tear up. Unless you like spicy stuff, then I would strongly advise you to stick with the butter. Other than, the food was very good. They offer both American and German cuisine. I'd recommend going with the German for a truly authentic experience.

name: India Garden
address: 207 N Delaware St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Food is OK by American Indian food standard, and delivery is fast enough. however there's simply not enough meat. I ordered $45 and finished all but still feel like not enough meat, and I actually asked them for more meat with less rice. I'm 150lbs and 2 big macs would be good enough for me so you can imagine how little meat was there. finally no napkin at all. 2 stars for the taste but that's it, sorry.
Ordered from doordash, hardly any meat in the curry and the taste was so sweet it was not able to eat to food. This place has gone down hill very fast. Would not recommend them.

If I could rate zero stars I would purely on the service here. They are extremely rude and talk bad about their customers. My husband caught them talking about him in their language which is unacceptable whenever we are paying them for a service. They should be happy that people pay for their non authentic garbage! There are other Indian restaurants in Indy that better deserve the attention this place gets. Overall, this restaurant is not worth the money, time, nor the poor experience
The menu and service were beyond our expectations. I surely enjoyed the ambience of this spot. First-rate restaurant to take the family out for lunch.

Bad food, rude owners and no free parking. I ordered Navratan Korma and got boiled vegetables with little bit of herbs added to it. Very disgusting and cheap. We also heard the owners trash talk about their customers when we were waiting for our order to take out. There are much better restaurants around. Do yourself some favor and avoid this place. I won’t be returning back here for sure.

name: Tony's of Indianapolis
address: 110 W Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: We chose Tony's for a special birthday treat and we were not let down at all. I've traveled the US and ate at so many steakhouses, but I am simply at a loss for words at how AMAZING the food was. I had an inch thick Ney York Strip that was PERFECT all the way through. Me fiance had the bone in ribeye that was beyond compare! Highly recommend the truffle wedges as a side(which feed 2-4 people). They were crispy, fluffy potato wedges of heaven.  The staff was always ready to help and make sure everything was perfect. Also a special occasion was that the owner, Tony, was there! He personally spoke with every guest and interacted one on one with his staff to make sure there was a flawless execution and presentation.  There were 2 other managers who were also monitoring the atmosphere of the restaurant, the amazing live music, and the customer experience as well. both Tony and the two managers took time to know our names and speak with us momentarily while we ate, and also took time to learn our birthdays and wish my fiance a happy birthday.  Never had such an amazing experience at any restaurant of any kind let alone a steakhouse. Would recommend this to any friends, family or stranger.  Worth every penny!! We will definitely be life long patrons!

This restaurant was recommended to me by a business man who frequents Indianapolis.  It was the best recommendation I have ever received.  Fantastic food.  Fantastic service.  Fantastic decor.   The prices are appropriate for the quality of the restaurant.

After my third time dining at Tony’s I thought I would leave a review. Every time there has been absolutely amazing. Steaks are great and the sweet potatoes are to die for. They truly treat you as family there, and I look forward to dining there again. BEST STEAKHOUSE IN INDIANAPOLIS

This is a true dining experience. The crab cake is out of this world, the braised short ribs will melt in your mouth and the vanilla bean bread pudding is delicious! Our waiter was Peyton and he made the experience truly exceptional. The service is impeccable!!! We've never had this kind of dining experience. We'll be going back!

The staff was amazing very informative. Then there was the food everything from the appetizers to main courses everything had a very savory taste with beautiful presentation! I highly recommend Tony's if your looking for a good mixture of steak and seafood with a very relaxing atmosphere.

name: Subito
address: 44 Virginia Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Subito is a well known secret lunch destination for downtown employees. Small shop with carry-out only. (No dine in) Line usually stretches out the door, but they are New York deli fast. Amazing sandwiches, soups, & salads, cookies. Check their online calendar for daily soup options. Also the only macaroni salad I've ever liked.

Great little "hole in the wall" serving outstanding soups and sandwiches. The staff is friendly, the food is outstanding. There are no tables or seats here, it is to go only. At lunch there is a crowd, often out the door, but it doesn't take long to get through the line. Every bowl of soup comes with their amazing fresh baked rolls. Give them a try, you will be back again if you do.
I got the Scottsdale salad and it was AWESOME! Great portion size that kept me full all day! It was so good I forgot to take a picture of it! Oops! This take-out establishment is a real gem!

You might assume that since this place specializes in soups that their sandwiches must be an afterthought. Don't make that mistake. The soups are delicious, but the sandwiches really are the best in town. The Revelo has an amazing combo of creamy, melted cheese, tender pork, and some jalapenos to add a little heat. I'll be back!
Excellent service, all good made in house. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Only downside is no where to sit inside

name: Meridian Restaurant & Bar
address: 5694 N Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46208, USA
reviews: Incredible! Food quality exceptional. Service impeccable.  The executive chef came out to check on us. Pricey but one of the few "fine dining " I would reccomend.
Nice ambience and very welcoming service. The food was crisp and delicious. Will surely recommend this spot to anyone. Fair prices and big portions. Keep up the great work.

Been here twice, for anniversary and a birthday/ valentine's day. 

Food is awesome, honestly not really expensive for how good it is. All the staff are super friendly. Drinks are great. 

Definitely a good place to go for a nice occasion.

We celebrated here for a friends birthday,  and it was delicious. They have a great wine and cocktail list and a unique, exceptional food menu. Everyone loved everything they ordered, but we all especially loved the fried oysters. Our server was also very knowy about everything on the menu. Definitely recommend!
They have the best keokie coffee here. (Very smooth.)  Definitely worth a repeat visit with some dining.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse
address: 41 E Washington St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Yummy! The mans and I went here for our 3 year anniversary & from start to finish, the service was excellent! I forgot our server's name but he was super nice! Drinks were excellent, the wagyu meatball appetizer was delicious, and the steaks were flavorful and cooked just right. We even got an on the house dessert! The manager came over and made sure we had no problems as well, and we got to take home a personalized menu & a black card picture of us with "happy anniversary" on it. By the time we took leftovers home, they gave us a full sized bread loaf instead of the half eaten one we had. Ambiance is great and it was one of the most memorable anniversaries I've ever had. :)

So many good things I can say about our experience here for our 16 year Anniversary. The service was top notch, the food was amazing, it was a great experience all together.  Mark, our server was so very helpful and informative.

5 stars don't even begin to describe how GREAT our whole experience was!! From the beginning, the valet attendants were extremely nice and professional. We were celebrating our 5 year anniversary. We had personalized menus and a picture taken of us to celebrate the occasion!! The food was delicious!! Bacon wrapped scallops and a chopped salad. Bone in  ribeye streak that melted in our mouths! Rack of Lamb, sour cream mashed potatoes and asparagus. We had a complimentary dessert to compete our meal. Morton's hot chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream! The food was so fantastic, but the service was impeccable!! The wonderful people working there are what made the experience unforgettable. They left no stone unturned when it came to taking care of our needs. Our server was perfect! Already planning our next trip back!

We had a gift card so we went for the first time! We happened upon Devour Downtown, so that was nice. Everything was delicious, from the bread to the French Onion soup, Chicken Christopher and Key Lime Pie. My husband said his steak was amazing and cooked perfectly. Rob was a very attentive and accomplished server. This restaurant has a cool old vibe in the basement. Oh, and my Lemom Drop martini was perfect!!

This is the best steakhouse in the city.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the desserts were amazing!  It is very pricey but worth the occasional visit to spoil yourself.  The staff was very good and the chef really cater to my wife's dietary restrictions.  Great place

name: Weber Grill Restaurant
address: 10 N Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Great location, fantastic facility, excellent service, great portions. Food seems to be hit or miss. We've been there before and had fantastic food. This time, pork chops perfectly cooked medium, but the meat was tough. Beer can chicken over cooked and under seasoned. BBQ meatloaf. Supposed to be smoked. Zero smoke taste, nothing special. Sides were great.

YUM!!  My family loves grilled food, so we made a special trip to the Weber Grill restaurant.  We wanted to try everything on the menu!  It will take a couple of trips for us to accomplish that, but we are up for the challenge.  We loved everything we tried.   Perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked! I definitely recommend this place - for dinner and dessert!!
Over all was very good. Service was great. Our server Jennifer was great and on top of it. We where in and out in a hour.  Not to bad for a Friday night

It was my first time there and my first date with my partner. The food was amazing. Our New York strip steaks were cooked to perfection. The service was beyond exceptional. Our server Tara  was on point. We never had to ask for anything. I found out it was her first night serving and I was amazed at her knowledge of the menu. Honestly Tara made the experience a perfect 10. We will definitely be back.
This restaurant has really gone downhill. We used to love coming here. Food is still pretty good, although not great, but the service is terrible. Unfortunate.

name: Nesso
address: 339 S Delaware St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Had a great time. Lovely looking and tasting food. Our server (Rebecca) was fabulous, friendly, and knowledgeable with great suggestions. Thanks Nesso for a truly wonderful meal.  Meals pictured are the oxtail with pea mousse stuffed pasta, sea bass with braised celery and fava beans, chicken over orzo with black kale, then dessert sour dough donuts with berry compote and drizzled with aged balsamic. Definitely a must go to spot for foodies.

Delicious food!  The oysters on a half shell were amazing.  The bread basket is unexpectedly very tasty.  The olives wrapped in sausage were a nice twist.  The calamari is some of the best I've ever had! Thre scallops and the short rib were absolutely delicious!!! I'll definitely be going back!!

At the first moment  you come to this restaurant  the stuff gives you a great feeling. Very congenial team, it is a kind place to  enjoy with friends or with your date. Excellent  food, experienced  chief cook and stuff, decent  pay and courteous  service. Highly recommended.

Beautiful restaurant, great new interior. Really enjoyed the wine from Italy and the halibut. Was expecting more from the beets and heirloom tomato appetizer as they didn't stand out as anything special. Don't forget to grab the espresso candy on the way out!

Clean Italian dishes elevated into a full experience. Chooses a dish per person but make sure to share and eat communally.  If not pick the scallops. They are perfection. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and will explain everything on the menu. They are friendly and professional. They are top notch but without seeming pretentious or stuffy.

name: 1913 Restaurant
address: 40 W Jackson Pl, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Food and service are always perfect. Best breakfast buffet anywhere.
Breakfast buffet and omelette station was good....if it’s open. If the hotel is not busy they don’t bother setting it up. Your only privileged when they are too?

I received a free dinner for 2 package at the 1913 Restaurant for some photography services I provided. Despite my wife and I being one of 3 couples (6 whole people) in the entire restaurant, our food took almost an hour to get to our table after ordering.

However, the food was absolutely amazing. We asked the waiter to thank the chef for us, and most of the kitchen staff came out to say hello and collect our thank you in person. It was pretty cool :)

This restaurant is in the Omni Hotel.  The valet, hostess, servers, and manager were very attentive. Four of us met for dinner and had a drink at the bar where a friendly bartender served us drinks before dinner.We then had the arugula and pear salad that was chocked full of candied pecans and toasted pumpkin seeds. Yum!The walnut crusted walleye was served with a harvest rice blend. The dish was very good but could have used alittle more sauce.
Nice restaurant with good farm to table options.

name: Shoefly Public House
address: 122 E 22nd St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: The guy in a shirt and a hat is the best. It's a little pricey but good for going there occasionally. The lady that served my table might not be in the mood that day though.

I love the local selection of beers and wine, as well as the locally sourced ingredients. The food was okay. Enjoyed it with black current mead from New Day in Indy. The restaurant itself is really cute inside, with great music and fun decor. This restaurant is somewhat pricey, but you are paying for locally grown and raised goods. Definitely a place to go for more special meals.

Shoefly has become my "go  to place" to grab a beer after a long day of work or school. From the beer list to the food menu, Shoefly offers delicious options for anyone's palate.The low key, calming ambiance provides a relaxing experience each time I visit.  The staff is friendly,welcoming and knowledgeable about the items they serve. Overall, I recommend anyone visit Shoefly!

Great Atmosphere and the food is unique. The only knock I have is their Diet Soda is not very good but I’m sure this is just personal preference. I prefer Diet Coke as an option. Love coming here to eat lunch!

So thankful for their grocery menu at affordable prices that feels very safe and clean (employees wearing gloves, employees only in the restaurant, curbside handoff is quick and the food is all fresh and high quality). 

Their menu always has lots of different/unique protein options and there are always different combos and flavors to try!

name: Spoke & Steele
address: 123 Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: I don't normally give 5 stars at any place no matter how good I think it is. But this place has absolutely exceeded my expectations with their food and service. The menu isn't pages long. (Thank goodness). In fact it's short, simple and very direct. The staff is super friendly and very much on point. Not ever have I encountered what many say is to be a "hidden gem", but definitely this place is genuinely just that! I'll be raving over this place for YEARS to come. The staff should expect me to become a regular customer on the weekends. Words can not describe the positive vibes I'm feeling after eating here.
Very busy night for them! Made last minute reservations and got seated 1/2 hour late. No problem! Understandable! Great over busy staff.  Food was different and delightful.

Definitely felt out of place however, the customer service was pleasant and they were very polite. The prices are what I would consider once in a blue moon kind of pricing. The atmosphere is very rustic with a classic vibe. Food was on point.

The menu was great, the service was great and the chef delivered one of the courses herself. The food was outstanding. I recommend the shrimp and pork bao. #amazing
Drinks were wonderfully unique.
Still the best Sauzerac that I've had in Indy. The seasonal cocktail menu they have now is lots of fun. The food is also top notch.

name: Yard House
address: 15 W Maryland St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Just from a burger perspective...not spectacular. It was cooked fine but neither the toppings nor the bun nor the meat were imho worth the higher price tag. Other food might be great and service was definitely awesome!! The cheese curd app was good - all the apps are definitely portioned for 4-5 people.

Just went there for lunch.  Had a fantastic Cobb salad.  Their beer selection is incredible.  They have one of the largest lists of appetizers I have ever seen.  You can have dinner with the appetizers.  If you did you would miss their lobster and steak choices. I will return.

Visited Yard House as a party of four people and reserved our spot through OpenTable. When we arrived we were immediately sat and the hostess staff was super friendly. The atmosphere is like any other Yard House you may visit and can always be a great time! Our food was prepared in a timely fashion and we all enjoyed our meals. We’re glad we chose Yard House for our company dinner outing while in Indy and will visit again if we visit downtown Indy again.

This was one of the few places open late night on a Saturday. I checked out the menu online and was impressed. When I arrived it was a condensed late night menu. I got the Nashville hot chicken. I was disappointed with the price ($16) for chicken and pancakes. I would have like another choice of side dish. But the chicken was good. 

They have a late night happy hour food menu with less expensive options but nothing really looked filling. I also didn’t think there were many healthy options aside from salad. 

If you’re looked for food late night it’s really this or Steak and Shake. Or go during the day to experience the full menu.

This place seems to always get it right. No matter how packed they are the service is always efficient and friendly. I love the beer selection, there is something for everyone. I would give it five stars if there were more menu items that I like. AND they do not have salsa on hand. Crazy! :)

name: Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant
address: 35 N Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Had a great time celebrating our friends birthday here! Zoie our server was super nice and helped make sure our night was perfect! The cost was totally worth it with all the food we got and only $13 per person! We had a coupon from online for making a reservation that saved us lots of money. Also, you’ll always order too much food! We knew ahead and ordered the perfect amount!

My boyfriend and I went the day after Valentine’s Day with reservations set. Right when we got checked in we felt as if the hosts and food runners were a tad rude. Our server was great along with the other servers around us. They did happen to accidentally take our entree to another table but they were honest and handled it well. The manager was a very nice guy! Overall, it was a nice first visit! We will definitely be back. The food was phenomenal!

To preface, my wife and I go to Buca quite a bit.  Especially, the downtown Seattle and Las Vegas locations.  

The meal started out good and our server Christina was helpful and fun to talk to.   

For an appetizer, the mussels were really good. However, the chopped salad, which is usually great at other locations, was just plain horrible.  When we received it, it looked like it had been sitting in the servers window for a long time and was warm/soggy 

While waiting for our entree, I got up to use the restroom.  Some of the kitchen staff were in the public areas.  Very unusual.  No hellos or anything even though I said hello.   They gave me the feeling like I was holding them up from going home.   

I got back to the table and we were served the spicy chicken rigatoni.  I know what this is supposed to look like folks, but it didn't look like anything close.  Totally dried out rigatoni, not saucy and there was hardly any chicken.   At this point, we just told our server to box it up and requested our check.  Even though we were still hungry, it was time to leave. 

Finally, we received the bill.  My wife was charged $60 for 3 wines that should have been $13 each.  I think they may have charged us for large pours, but we received short ones.  Again, we have been to other locations.
