$167 after tip and we had a $25 off coupon.  
Horrible dining experience.  

I know that this is after lots of great experiences at other locations, but it makes me feel like not going back to Buca period.

Fabulous food. Vegetarian friendly. They even have a vegetarian menu! So rare. Interesting seasonal menu. Portions are quite large. I ordered a single entree and ended up taking part of it home with me. The service was perfect. I was attended to politely and in friendly and helpful manner. Ambience is interesting. I wasn't sure how to describe it. Check out the photos. But it felt warm and welcoming.

Makes you feel like you walked into your Italian grandmother’s house for dinner. Good food. Food is like dinner at home. Different plates serve different amounts of people. You can get lost in there but it is definitely a unique experience.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 6815 82nd St, Indianapolis, IN 46250, USA
reviews:
We had made reservations in person a week prior for a specific table at 5:00 and a specific waitress.  We had requested a large round table because we had a party of eight. When we arrived, they were not going to give us that table and when they did, we were informed that we had to be done by 7:00. 
When we were seated, it was not the waitress we had requested.  This waitress was OK until it was time for the bills.  Even though she confirmed who was with whom, when she returned with the bills 15 minutes later, they were wrong.  
She wrote out the orders again, by couple, and added all drinks and said she'd  be  right back.  During the 15 minutes it took her to return, a couple of restaurant staff walked by the table and looked at their watches.  
When she returned we all gave our credit cards and one member of our group asked if they gave a military discount.  She said they did and asked for his ID and said she would adjust his bill. 
After another 15 minutes, and a few more looks from staff, a member of our group went to the front to let them know we had been waiting for over half an hour for our bills.  
When the bills were finally brought back, the one who had asked for a military discount, was $5 MORE !   
We were pretty irritated by now, and just paid and left.  On the way out, we overheard a staff member say,  "Yes, they finally left." We would have been gone a good half hour earlier if the waitress had gotten the bills correct.  
We have enjoyed eating here in the past, at least once a month, but this visit will cause us to rethink our choices.

Had a great time at Charleston's. We arrived during the dinner rush time, and although the parking lot seemed full we were seated immediately. Our server, Tina, was great. She was friendly and took great care of us. The atmosphere and decor are somewhat upscale yet relaxed. Plenty of great options to choose. Our group had the Chicken tortilla soup, chicken enchiladas, and chicken picata. And for dessert we split a slice of key lime pie. Everything was great
Awesome, absolutely divine if you want something mouth-watering served with great care and compassion this is the place to go... Every meal has been prepared with exquisite taste!!
Nice dark woods and cozy booths, plus really good, well made Americana food.  This is my idea of perfect restaurant ambiance.
Classy environment. Menu has decent variety, good food with big portions. Would not recommend the baked beans. Would recommend the pork chops and the hickory burger.

name: The Eagle Mass Ave
address: 310 Massachusetts Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Great spot on Mass Ave for dinner and/or drinks. The fried chicken is very tasty and so are all the sides. The chicken sandwich is a go to! Fun bar scene and large patio is also a plus.
Family style southern cuisine. They have communal seating. Come ready to make friends because this is the spot for it. Double sided bar for double the fun. Can't wait until the patio is open.

My husband and I were first time customers 3 weeks ago.  Sat at the bar and had the pleasure of having a female bartender, I think Kaylee?  Anyway, she was fabulous!  Very attentive even though it was getting busier.  Ordered drinks and food and all was amazing!  Sides and whole chicken are large enough to share.  Great experience..we will be back!!

That was a disappointment: I received a recommendation from a local guy that actually works in cuisine recommendation. We went the first day, an hour wait. The next day, 45 minute wait.... at this point the build up us great.

The third time we tried we had a seat at the bar. Nice bartender helped us select drinks (pretty common, nothing special), and I ordered the famous fried chicken with spicy honey.... Well, it was a friend chicken. That's it. The honey was just honey and some spice.

I really don't get the hype about this place. I had better fried chicken in most diner and chains in other places

First of all, THANK YOU to Maddie working at the front for genuinely taking the time to find my bracelet that I lost. You are a saint and deserve a raise for going the extra mile for customer care. Also, the food and atmosphere of The Eagle is awesome year round, and highlighted in the summer with the great patio seating. We love bringing people here that haven’t had it before because they always leave so happy and satisfied. Thank you!

name: Iaria's Italian Restaurant
address: 317 S College Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Fantastic Italian restaurant. We got there right when it opened and it was immediately hoppin'. The service from the second we walked in to paying the bill 10/10 service. Now the food part. The food was wonderful as well. Both the fried mozerella and lasagna were very tasty and came out hot.
Small, but cozy place. Great food and atmosphere, everytime. Marinara sauce with cheesy garlic bread is amazing. So is the tortellini!

Let me start off by saying I’m very disappointed by the food I had today. After my grandma and best friend hyped this place up to I was expecting a lot more quality. I came today to participate in Devour Indy and I wish I didn’t. I ordered the chicken Marsala and the chicken Parmesan which I usually LOVE!! The sauce was too sweet and all of our chicken was tough. I came with 2 other people and they share my same opinion. The establishment was clean and the waitress was great!!! But my food was not a good representation of what I was told it would be!

I made a reservation through this Google page for last night. Google said I had the reservation. When my date and I got to there, they said I didn't have one. I showed them on my phone the reservation I had, and they agreed that it said I did, but didn't offer anything to us. They said the wait would be at least an hour. The manager called today and only offered an insincere apology, and said they only use Yelp for reservations. It did seem like a nice place, but we were not able to experience it. I can't give anything but a 1 star review for this experience.

The food was beyond delicious! Definitely one of the best places for Italian food. I recommend the stuffed ziti with their sauce. My mouth is honestly watering just writing this review! The place is extremely cozy and very family oriented. I can’t wait to go back!

name: Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurant
address: 3815 E 96th St, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews: I've been coming to Cooper's for well over 3 years. This location has been consistently exceeding my expectations in service and quality. I appreciate having the convenience of booking a table on open table. Cooper's is great when family or friends come in from out of town as the menu is great for anyone. Love the membership and the perks that follow it. Monthly tastings and bottles in addition to having discounts and rewards!

Such an AMAZING carry out Easter meal! We ordered the ham and short ribs that came complete with Mary's potatoes with gravy, broccoli (perfectly cooked) the freshest and BIGGEST mixed salad, pretzel bread with butter, a WHOLE pie and a bottle of wine - for 200 -- there were five of us and we had enough leftover for full meal for all five us.  The food was wonderfully prepared -- and packaged -- so neatly with ALL serving utensils.  All the heated goods were in containers that easily went from low-temp oven where we kept warm for an hour - to our counter for self-serving.  I was SO impressed and happy with everything.  I would recommend this option whether the restaurant was closed or not!  Although the service at CH is impeccable and I do miss wine tastings. Look forward to being back.  THANK YOU INDIANAPOLIS CREW for putting together a beautiful meal for our family this Easter.

We came here on a Friday night and were seated promptly. Our server was good too, albeit slightly busy. However, we did not enjoy the food. Almost everything was over-seasoned. The soy ginger salmon was too sweet and the short rib risotto was too salty. The fries came lukewarm and were also too salty. My favorite dish of the night was probably the pretzel bread served at the start of the meal. Nice touch to have free wine tasting, though. Hopefully the food quality improves.

Simply the best! Been coming here for four years but Christopher made tonight an extra special experience.  Always on point with the wine (of course), the service, and the food!! Great place to take my aunt and uncle visiting from Mexico for the holiday.  Thanks Cooper’s hawk and Christopher!! 🙌🏼🙌🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼

The best place!!! Went for Valentines Day last night and not only did we have the best food, wine and dessert but our server was incredible. I forget her name but she’s been with the restaurant for 7 years and really knew her stuff! We felt well cared for on one of their busiest days of the year and it is the perfect place for a special celebration dinner! The gnocchi is incredible! Can’t wait to go back!

name: Major Restaurant
address: 1150 S Mickley Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46241, USA
reviews: Amazing restaurant with probably some of the best Ethiopian food I have ever had. The ambiance is okay (not my taste), the location is not great, but the food and coffee are excellent. Great place to order large platter with friends or family and try out a variety of dishes. Unlimited Injera (bread), and they will bring out delicious spicy sauces if you ask for it. Courteous and fast servers. My favorite place for Ethiopian food in Indy, and even though it is very far away from my house, I can't stop driving here to get food!

Simply amazing. Had the vegetarian combo plate for four, and every single dish on the plate was killer. The coffee ceremony is a must. The staff were super nice and helpful. The decor is beautiful and the ambiance is very fitting, with Ethiopian & Eritrean music playing over the speakers and frankincense thick in the air. Definitely some of the best Ethiopian food I've ever had.
Good Ethiopian food and prices are reasonable. I got the Beef Sampler.  It was very good. The food had a bit of spicy heat to it but not too much. Very flavorful.
Excellent service. The Major combination plate offers a wonderful variety of flavors.  Will definitely return.

I love this place. When I lived in Indianapolis I ate there a few times every month. Best Ethiopian food I have ever had. And the wait staff takes the time to explain to you what everything is and how it works.

name: The Library Restaurant & Pub
address: 2610 S Lynhurst Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46241, USA
reviews: For a Friday night, it was pretty quiet. Almost sure we brought the median age down about 20 years when we walked in. Went here based on a recommendation from our layover hotel, who also gave a coupon for a free dessert with dinner. Had the Prime Rib Manhattan, Medium Rare. Probably one of the BEST steaks I've ever had. Good marbling, thick, not overcooked, well seasoned. The green beans were nice and soft, not rubbery like some places. Sweet tea was the right amount of sweet without being too overbearing.  Had Lemon Tarts for the dessert. The raspberry drizzle was an excellent contrast. Did not expect to be wowed by food in Indy, but was definitely a nice surprise.

Not far from work and I enjoy trying restaurants other than chains. 
This place has the best club sandwich in town! Simply awesome! So good I visit several times a month. It’s worth the effort, it you sit at the bar say hi. Enjoy

The decor is a bit off and interesting but the food is definitely good.  The prime rib Manhattan was tasty and the stuffed salmon was light and refreshing.  Be forewarned to get there early because they do sell out of the prime rib.  I would like to come back again during warmer weather and sit out on the patio area they have.

Like the sign says "Best Prime Rib in Indianapolis." (It is herb encrusted and takes 18 hours to prepare.)  They also have great cheesecake. There is no dress code here so business or casual is acceptable. (They have event rooms for proms and other events.)

Ordered food to go from here, that’s what we got for stuffed shrimp (only 6) a thumbnail potato and some ugly cabbage after waiting for 40 mins, charged us $30 and when I wanted to complain, the boy was so rude and start yelling at us. Definitely sure that this place not worth of your time and money to spend.

name: Maialina Italian Kitchen + Bar
address: 1103 Prospect St, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews: Hits the spot for comfort food especially on those frequent snowy nights. Portions are generous but not overwhelming. They provided fresh grated Parmesan. The pasta is cooked and flavored well. Had the gnocchi it was well season and perfectly cooked. Wait staff professional and friendly.

The pasta and meatballs were superb. The staff was so friendly and accommodating esp. Emily. One of us ordered the Salmon with artichokes, a special order. The cooks were so gracious to accommodate our request with the salmon topped by a delicious helping of grilled artichokes.

The best Italian food I've had since Arthur Street in Brooklyn.  We all shared a little of our dinners so was able to taste many items.  My dish was Sausage and broccolini, a common dish in restaurants on the east coast but you don't see it much in the mid-west.  The kale salad was the most unique.  Every dish was very good.  Very comfortable atmosphere, very friendly and knowledgeable service staff.

I've been wanting to try this place since I've seen it pop up on Instagram, finally had the chance to set up a dinner for my 30th bday. Located in the old smoke house in fountain square it's been redone into a classic/trendy lounge style Italian place.
Our service was awesome! I love when recommendations are made and dishes are explained.
I have to say you must get the aperol spritz, it's the house cocktail and it's awesome, light and refreshing and the largest cocktail they offer.
I'm not typically an appetizer person but we decided to get the bruschetta, but it was a non traditional style with hot honey and ricotta and it was amazing, im going to try and make the dish myself.
For the main course I had the vongole, a delicious pasta dish with garlic tomatoes and clams. I also had a delicious white wine blend, and to top the whole night off I had a tiramisu on the house as a birthday treat. Awesome experience I can't wait to go back!

Reminded me of the neighborhood Italian restaurants from the 90's, but in a contemporary space.  Growing up with those meant the menu was full of comfort foods.  Service was very attentive.  Nothing stood out.  All in all a solid choice, but not something to go out of your way for.

name: Rick's Cafe Boatyard
address: 4050 Dandy Trail, Indianapolis, IN 46254, USA
reviews:
We can’t say enough great things about Rick’s Café Boatyard. 
We decided to have our wedding reception here because of the view onto Eagle Creek, the beautiful grounds, and the pricing for the venue. I had never eaten at the restaurant but my husband assured me that the food is fantastic. When we first contacted them, the events manager, Savannah, was quick to respond with the menu and all the options we would have for our special day. She was super patient and so understanding with all of our questions. Wedding planning can be stressful but Savannah’s cheerfulness just made us feel more comfortable. She’s really a pleasure to work with. There are many different packages for food and drinks that you will find what you’re looking for within in your budget. For our tasting, Savannah and Nathalie made sure we had a perfect experience and even equipped us with a sheet to jot our opinions about each plate- these little details really made a difference for us. We decided to do our own decorations for this event and the staff was very accommodating in creating our vision. Savannah even coordinated with our vendors to make sure everything would arrive on time. On the day of, we received so many compliments about the entire staff. The bartender remembered my name and made sure I never went without a drink. Once the outbreak is over and we can have gatherings again, please consider Rick’s for any event you’re looking to host.

A superb restaurant! This place was recommended because of their great food and its proximity to Eagle Creek airport. (KEYE) We flew in to Eagle Creek and took a 3 minute walk across the street to Rick's. It was Valentine's Day, so they were packed. We had a table next to the big windows with a great view over the water. The seafood was fresh and the wine was good. If you're a pilot, this is a dining fly in must.

I am sorry, but I forgot to take some pictures of the food! It was just so good I had to eat it all quickly! My wife liked the food, my brother liked the food. The atmosphere is nice, the waiters are great. I will come back again with more people and pictures.

My family has enjoyed many years at Rick's. Today, though the service was a bit challenging, we were patient as we knew Rick's holds a standard for their service. I suppose every restaurant has its day because, as we all know well people are unpredictable and you know what a person is dealing it. We are very understanding group. But the minor issues were immediately corrected by the manager, Nick. Thank you Nick,l for upholding the standard in your restraunt. The food is always presented well, and the bottomless mimosas are a nice addition to Brunch. Definitely try the stuffed french toast. It's a signature dish even if the menu doesn't say it! I recommend Rick's for drinks, meals, and ambiance. Will always be one of my favorite places in Indy! ❤
Amazing place to go out with your girl. I had a great experience there. You can even go for lake side walk. And in summers you can sit at outside bar.

name: The Old Spaghetti Factory
address: 210 S Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46225, USA
reviews: Had a great time here! Awesome food and good service! Had a large group and we were in a rush!! The server made sure we got our food in time and that we felt super accommodated! Made it to our meeting on time with room for ice cream! Cool atmosphere and decor, too!

This is a fantastic place. We've been coming here since the 80s. The atmosphere is awesome. The food is great and always served hot. We always go on Sundays for the waiter Juan only works on Sundays. He is an excellent waiter. He has waited on us for years.
The kitchen manager is fantastic. Josh keeps everything going.

I'm from Louisville, Ky and we have this restaurant here but even with one in my backyard, I've never eaten here. While in the area we decided to eat here and I was blown away. The waitress, Ashley, was super friendly and helpful. I ordered the lasagna and was really wonderful. The decor is really nice and feels like you're stepping back in time. Highly recommend this establishment.

Awesome spot for friends and family alike. Great atmosphere. Really good food. 5/5 on the food. All entrees are 3 course meals. Soup/salad, entree, ice cream. (Skip the vanilla and go for the local favorite, it's amazing!)
Oh, and there's a train car in the building that you can eat your dinner in... Awesome time tonight at the Old Spaghetti Factory!!
This will be one of my favorites. It was my first time back in a while. The service was good and the food was off the chain.

name: ATHENS ON 86th
address: 2284 W 86th St West, Indianapolis, IN 46260, USA
reviews:
Apart from spicy feta which was average all the meal was under average. I specifically asked if they were using fresh fish for grouper and our waiter said yes. When I received the meal and told her this wasn't fresh fish, she started with a whole different story. 
Their daily specials that had seafood kebab, the waiter said that it is a mistake, on the menu it was written Taramosalada that this is one of the most popular appetizer on Greek table, she said they do not have it any more.
The octopus that i took was very hard to chew.
I don't think that i will be back. 
Sorry.

Awesome local Greek restaurant! Very diverse menu that can accommodate a wide variety of palates and diets. Enjoyed the vegetarian moussaka with rice and green beans - very delicious and a perfectly sized portion. Atmosphere is great too; well decorated and not too crammed with seating so you have space between tables. Wait staff is friendly and attentive.
As always, delicious food!  A relaxing ambience and very pleasant wait staff.  I always highly recommend Athens on 86th for a fine ding experience.

Authentic and delicious! Stopped in for lunch had the Greek spaghetti and my oh my oh my what a pleasant surprise! Delicious! The bread they brought to the table was warm and buttery goodness I wish I could have it sent home back in Michigan.

We were seated quickly, and our drink order was taken.  Drinks arrived quickly and our food order was taken.  The salads and bread arrived quickly, and were both delicious.  Our entrees arrived at the proper time; after we finished the salad and before we started wondering where the food was.
The food.... wow!  I ordered the Taste of Greece, as I like to sample a variety of items at a restaurant I'm visiting for the first time.  Every single item was amazing.  I'm very impressed.

name: His Place Eatery - Chicken & Waffles, Ribs and Soul Food
address: 6916 E 30th St, Indianapolis, IN 46219, USA
reviews:
I would eat here every day for the rest of my life if I could. I'd weigh 300 and I'd be broke, but I would be happy. The food is exceptional. I particularly like the smoked meat loaf wrapped in pepper bacon. The rib tips are excellent, as is the country fried steak, as well as the smoked brisket, fried catfish, chicken and waffles, and many more delicious menu items. 

Today I had a boneless fried chicken breast smothered in an onion gravy that was sensational. The sides are over the top: my favorites are the creamy mac and cheese and the flavorful cholard greens, but try the bourbon creamed corn, too. 

I like the laid back family atmosphere -- many families with little ones, and no one in a hurry to leave. And I especially like that the owner, Chef James, comes around and greets his guests at their tables as time permits.

By the way, the Banana Pudding is out of this world good -- so smooth and creamy and full of banana slices and vanilla wafers. If you like great soul food, you will absolutely love His Place Eatery!

This place is a foodies dream , I had rib tips with collard greens, and macaroni cheese. The tips were very tender on the sweet side with the spices . The greens , and the macaroni and cheese were wonderful tasting . I ordered a cat fish sandwich to go oh my lord some of the best cat fish I ever had . Wow I’m impressed with the great taste . The staff was super friendly fast service, very clean restaurant. The menu is nice size something for everyone here.

Absolutely delicious!! The restaurant was packed when we arrived and it was worth the wait. The pulled pork is some of the best I've ever had and the creamed corn was perfect! Can't wait to go back and try the chicken and dumplings which they were sold out of when we went.

This is my favorite restaurant in Indianapolis area. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a home cooked meal or even a catered holiday family meal. The staff is great and the owner is always awesome. He really cares about his customers and even comes out to greet them at the table. He helps wait and clean tables when things are busy and that’s always a great quality to see in upper management . I hope they expand and bring this delicious food to south bend !!!!!

First time at this restaurant ordered food to go. All good signs when you see customers coming in frequently and the delicious aroma in the restaurant.

The ribs, fried chicken collard greens,mac and cheese  and the peach cobbler were so tasty and delicious. They really know soul food i felt so good after i savored each bite.

Best soul food i had in a long time. Will definitely be back again when im in Indiana.

Only thing is they need a bigger restaurant to accommodate more people.

name: Three Carrots City Market
address: 222 E Market St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: My favorite lunch spot in the city market. All vegan menu with great flavors and great service.  Everything is so fresh and made to order.

The pulled seitan burger here was delicious! I didn't like the seitan high fives as much, but it wasn't bad and the sauce for it was fantastic :) I also really enjoyed the atmosphere of the city market with all the different food vendors, the big open space and open seating with lots of light, and when I went for lunch, there was a chorus performing for the holidays.
A great place to explore the world of vegan/vegetarian dishes. Because it is in the City Market, you can sample the food without committing to anything actual restaurant. The flavors were incredible!

An Indianapolis classic. Excellent food and service, wide array of (comfort food with international influence) dishes and the menu evolves often enough to keep it interesting. Best biscuits and gravy in the city. They're a seitan supplier for other restaurants around Indy and it shows. If you make only one vegan stop in town this is it.

I loved it! Dessert, breakfast, lunch, they have it all! At the cashier was so sweet! The stuff available was decently affordable. I missed it the first time I came here but I'm glad I found it and finally tried them out! Their vegan food is great! I'll be coming back every time I come to Indy! Even my 4yr old loved it here, and we became friends with the cashier too.

name: Repeal Restaurant
address: 630 Virginia Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46203, USA
reviews: This place was nice and chill. Service was great and food was pretty good too. I asked our server for a recommendation since this was my first time. The brisket tacos were awesome and I really enjoyed the flavors. Looking forward to coming back to explore the rest of the menu.

I had perfect fish and chips.  I don't usually like greens, but I tasted some of my dinner companion's and I would eat greens this delicious all day.  Amidst the list of intriguing cocktails I chose the "apple pie" cocktail as my dessert and was richly rewarded.Repeal also has an eclectic, t historic atmosphere.  Despite how delicious dinner was, our server, Carol, was the best part of the evening!  Friendly and charming without being too much in our business.

We had a group of 7 on a Saturday evening. The place is very small and they were busy but they were able to get us a table quickly. The food was very good. We all got different appetizers and dinners. Everyone enjoyed their food and drinks.

We went on a Saturday afternoon and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The space is very welcoming with a great ambiance. The food is fantastic! The bartenders are knowledgeable and know how to make a great drink. Highly recommend the Selfish Hawaiian Nachos! Highly recommend this place! We will be back!

Now for the food. By the time I got my food, the cheese and oil in the Alfredo sauce had started to separate. There wasn't a ton of sauce and the sauce didn't have much of any flavor. It did seem like the cheese was fresh but it would have been nice to have some garlic and salt in the sauce at least. The bread and salad were good.

name: Aristocrat Pub & Restaurant
address: 5212 N College Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46220, USA
reviews:
This was another attempt of mine to find as close to authentic wiener schnitzel as I could. I was trying to satisfy a childhood memory of living in Austria and eating schnitzel. I was able to look past it being pork, rather than authentic veal. The first 5 bites were incredible. The closest to authentic I've found yet, but as I continued eating it, I started to get a sweet taste. I realized the cabbage had so much juice in it that it covered the bottom of the plate, tainting the flavor of the schnitzel. This is not what one would expect for a $20+ plate of food. I was just passing through town, and if I lived closer I would consider trying it again. I gave 4 stars still because a different kitchen crew might plate the food a little better.

Regardless of my schnitzel experience, the food was cooked very good. The atmosphere was cozy and comfortable. Prices were a little high, but they weren't out of line considering the area, the atmosphere, and the name of the restaurant itself.

Stopped here for lunch while in the area. This place has your typical pub menu with good prices. We like the food but didn't love it. The tenderloin was absolutely huge. Way to big for a lunch meal. It said tenderloin sandwich but there is no way to eat it like a sandwich. The service was fast and friendly!

They make a good tenderloin, maybe pounded a little to flat for my taste. The kettle chips are pretty good. The cost is a little much for what you get. Parking is the big issue with all the construction and they have a small lot. They have a nice patio out front to eat and a big selection of beers and alcohol.

Today i had lunch with my friend/realtor in the friendly & tasty confines of the aristocrat pub. Kathryn as always proved why she is a # 1 person & server. I have known her since 2005. Alans fish n chips meal must have been good! He was a member of the clean plate club. That made 2 of us. Great atmosphere, excellent food, super staff! Need i say more...

We've been going there since they opened in 1985 so they must be doing something right! Just good ole pub food, among other dinner options. Just like the feel of being there. Usually eat on the bar side door that true pub feel. Very nice servers and hosts.

name: Black Market
address: 922 Massachusetts Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews:
Really enjoyed this place for our anniversary dinner. Definitely a little on the foodie end but also everything is made from scratch. Rotating menu which I respect. 

I had some pasole and it was really really good. Expect to pay up for a scratch kitchen in a prime spot. Worth it for special occasions and I believe they have like $10 tacos so you don’t have to spend a fortune.

Black Market has been reinvigorated by new chef Esteban Rosas, who has transformed the food menu into somthing quite special. The new spring menu is full of bright colors and flavors, the roasted trout is a must try. The Octopus is super tender and perfectly cooked. Don't forget Wednesdays are half price bottles of wine!!!
Black Market has the best ambience of any restaurant I've found. The food is amazing too. I definitely miss their old menu, but they're pulling off the transition to Mexican food incredibly well.
PLEASE GET COFFEE. Dessert is not dessert without a cup of black coffee. Otherwise, great food. Very knowledgeable and accommodating staff. They have a wonderful set up for a larger group.

This place is perfect for a date night or a relaxing evening with a few friends.  The place is cozy so don't bring a party of 10.  This was my second visit.  I swear the first time I was here the menu was more Mediterranean but the website describes the restaurant as Modern Mexican.  Either way the food was delicious and I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Iron Skillet Restaurant
address: 2489 W 30th St #2268, Indianapolis, IN 46222, USA
reviews: I came here with my buddy, who’s a BIG “Little House on the Prairie” fan, so the aura of this restaurant was perfect for him. Going inside of the place felt like a step in time, imagining what a lovely dinner in the 1800’s would be like. Or close. Inside of this old, fancy former farm house was one of the best meals my buddy and I have had. Very charming on the inside. EXCELLENT food. Great waiter. Dinner was an experience. We ate like Kings of the Prairie. Highly recommended.

First time coming here and won't be the last. The restaurant is very nice on the inside. The dinner is served family style. They are best known for their chicken. The meals come with a ton of different sides, bread, salad, main entree, and ice cream for dessert. There is no way of leaving here hungry. By far the best part is the excellent service. We had our 20 month old daughter with us and the staff so good with her. It made for a very enjoyable experience. I highly recommend this place.

The food here is always delicious!  But watch your portions because the food is very rich.  You can get a small glass of tomato juice or creamy onion soup for starters.  (The creamy onion soup is not French onion soup, this is much better)!
Then if you've ordered ahead for your party, most people get their fabulous fried chicken.  You also get a wedge of lettuce with a delightful vinaigrette, mashed potatoes (lots of butter in it, so yummy, but really rich too), pickled beets, apple butter for the bread, green beans and at the end you get ice cream along with a silver serving set with bowls of syrups to pick from.  Oh, and at the end of the meal they bring everyone these steaming Jasmine-scented damp terrycloth towels to wipe your hands off well.  But it smells so good I can guarantee someone in your group will bury their nose in it for the heavenly scent.  The decor is absolutely beautiful, just be warned the restrooms are upstairs.  The servers are truly the best to make your event a wonderful memory.

Ben going there for over 50 years. Always pleased with food and service. Excellent for the whole family including the younger ones and the older ones. A previous review warned the bathrooms were upstairs. They also have downstairs bathrooms so do not let that be a deterrent. You will be please you went
Fantastic place! One of my favorites. I have been going here since I was a kid. Same great tasting food as always. I wonder what happened to the little gift shop?

name: Luciana's Mexican Restaurant and Cantina #2
address: 3716 E 82nd St, Indianapolis, IN 46240, USA
reviews: This was our first time here. We had GREAT service and the food was fantastic. We were in and out in an hour on a Friday night. Highly recommend. As authentic as you can get for being in Indiana. We will definitely be back!

Service was good.  Food was very reasonably priced.  My food was  a little over cooked/dry. Lighting was not flattering, which might be an issue for those of you trying to make a good first impression.  Would go back.
Delicious Mexican food. They give you a lot for a good price. Nice atmosphere and good service. There are also some house specialties.
Exceeded my expectations in customer service. If you love Mexican food this is the place to go. The prices are very fair. 🍹🍗🍖🍢🍡🍦🍨🍧🌽🍅
Always good food. Inexpensive and no long wait. Friendly staff.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse - Curbside To Go Available
address: 5840 W 86th St, Indianapolis, IN 46278, USA
reviews: Everything we had was extremely good. My steak was cooked to perfection enter appetizers was. The best experience I've ever had at a LongHorn steakhouse. You won't be disappointed with this place. Very friendly staff and the food came quick. The environment was very nice. Everyone enjoyed there selves.

Food is always amazing. Steaks cooked to perfection. Great service. My husband and I went on Valentine's Day evening. We knew it would be busy and we would have to wait a little while. We walked in just before it started to get even busier. We waited about 35-40 minutes. Not too bad considering how busy they were. I really thought it was cool that the host held a little boy for the majority of the time that the parents waited  to be seated. You don't see that very often. 
We had a good-sized table when we were finally seated, unlike some restaurants that have tiny tables for parties of two. 

My husband and I both got cups of loaded baked potato soup, Flo's 8 oz Filet medium-term. Yum. Our waitress Jody was great. We never ran out of drinks, and we was very busy, so that impressed us that she kept up. 

The only reason I gave 4/5 was because I feel they need a larger waiting area. They only have a few small benches, otherwise when they get very busy like tonight, guests are overflowing into the bar area and crowded at the entry. Overall, it was a great experience, though. Great job! We will definitely return! :)
Fantastic spot to eat something when in a hurry. Their service is quick, prices are affordable, excellent vibes. Keep up the good work

Went here for a business meal. Great service and team here. Management went above and beyond to  make sure we were happy due to a slight wait for a server for our table. Will definitely be back because of that!
Nice place and great food. People works there happy and very helpful with requests. Would definitely visit again.

name: Bakersfield Mass Ave
address: 334 Massachusetts Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: I absolutely love the tacos and margaritas! However when I went to order from the site during COVID-19 after they re-opened it says that this location is not excepting mobile orders and I made sure it said Indianapolis mass Avenue. So I called the restaurant and the hostess to answer told me that I cannot place an order over the phone but I had to go online. When I went to call back the line was busy I waited 15 minutes go back again the line was busy I love this restaurant but this was extremely disappointing experience.
AMAZING Tacos. Stopped for lunch and had drinks and tacos. So Delish! We sat in the basement (21 or over). We will definitely go back!

Good food and drinks. Would recommend trying the pineapple margarita. The tacos were flavorful but the portions were much smaller than expected. House made salsa is fresh and delicious and the loaded queso is a good accompaniment to fill you up when the tacos leave you wanting more.
Good tacos and friendly staff! Tacos seemed a little pricey for their size, but they were good. Would highly recommend trying!

Love this spot to split chips/queso and a pitcher of margaritas.  The patio in the back is a fun spot and also has another bar back there.  It also connects with their other restaurant through the patio called "Krueger's" which is also very good.

name: Union 50
address: 620 N East St, Indianapolis, IN 46202, USA
reviews: Ok things I liked: great atmosphere, delicious deserts,good customer service. Things I didn’t like: old scallops,too chewy. Coming to Indianapolis from Atlantic Canada, you learn about seafood freshness. Duck was great, good shrimp and grits (would have been nice if they didn’t have tails).
Absolutely amazing food!! Great atmosphere and live music. Our server Lindsey was super sweet and helped make great selections. My first time here and I'll definitely be back!!

Really nice atmosphere. The staff are incredibly kind and you can meet some really great people sitting around the bar. The live music is always on point and the food is great (although a bit pricey). I had an order of pastrami poutine that hit the spot - it was very salty towards the end though. Definitely one of the top places to dine at if you're looking for an upscale casual vibe.

It was very chill atmosphere. Intimate seating. The bar is absolutely beautiful to look at if you're into the industrial look. It's a little expensive - at least 100 for 2 people , not including dessert or many drinks

Went for my birthday which was on a Tuesday this year. Not crowded at all but not vacant either. Eric the waiter was great. Attentive but not around too much. Enjoyed the shrimp and grits but my dining partner had a room temperature lamb shank. It tasted delicious but needed to be hot coming out of the kitchen.  Will be back.

name: Dale's Family Restaurant
address: 5209 Thompson Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46237, USA
reviews:
1/25/2020 8:55am

This place is located in a strip mall with a pot 
holed parking lot. The front decor is inviting. 

Walking in the hostess greeted us and sat us in a booth. Decor is water themed, fire hydrants, hoses, and piping. The place is clean. 

Waitress greeted us, she was pleasant. 

Checked out the buffet (10.99$) but decided to order off the menu. More for your money. 

Update 12:48p - you will get explosive poo if you eat The biscuit and gravy; the gravy was greasy, the biscuits were good. Temperature was lukewarm. 

French toast full order came out cold, with cold syrup but it was good. Soft and fluffy. 

Hash browns are amazing! A must have. 

They are stingy with their napkins... if your sever comes back allowing you to ask - you better ask before or while you’re ordering.

This is a good place for comfort food! Check them out...

I was here in the morning 1.5 years ago over the weekend and ordered breakfast off the menu rather than the buffet.  I remember good service, large portions, fresh tasting food.  This time I went with family and had the buffet.  The hot food was mediocre.  It was about what you'd find in a nicer free hotel breakfast with sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, pancakes, french toast sticks, hash browns, sausage and biscuits.   Toppings were strawberry sauce, syrup, honey butter, cheese sauce.  They had a small selection of fresh fruit and cottage cheese.  Missing were toast, bagels, salsa, cream cheese, dispensers  with coffee, juice, grits, oatmeal, cold cereal,  granola, yogurt, nuts, raisins, cheese, cold salami, milk, muffins, donuts, tea (some of these could be bought separate and delivered by waitress if you wanted it).  So in some ways a free hotel breakfast buffet is better than this one.  And the hot food didn't seem that fresh even though we got there 30 min after opening at 8:30am.  Good, place, just not the buffet unless you're not expecting much variety.   The decor is nice.

We had breakfast here not too long ago. The coffee was very very good. Some of the best I've ever had. The biscuits and gravy was great. I ordered , The Emily.. I'm not sure why they named it that. It came with 3 eggs cooked to my preference,and a choice of ham, sausage or bacon. I chose bacon. The bacon was well cooked. They should've named it the Fat Alberta. Pan cakes looked great too. Their skillet meals were also very appealing. Clean restrooms. Nice decor,friendly staff quick service too.  So, if you're the owner, pls treat my grandmother and my aunt to a free meal, since they come in every morning. That would be cool. Oh and by the way, they have a rewards program.. eat 30 meals. Get 1 free. Great 1st impression for me.  Kudos to Dales!!!

I had never even heard of this place. Took a chance and wonderfully surprised! The yeast rolls ate amazing and they have the best green beans ever. Loved the pork chop special. Will definitely be going back!

Steak was ordered well done came medium well had to finish cooking it so it could be eaten ordered a baked potato they sent mashed potatoes. The chicken and dumplings had burnt dumplings and very little chicken. Was not worth the price.

name: Bazbeaux
address: 329 Massachusetts Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: The service here was great and so was the food! I ordered the house salad which was huge and 2 different dressings since I couldn't decide. They make all their dressings in house!!! I'm really particular about pizza crust and this was just right! It was not too soft and not too hard. Cozy and relaxed atmosphere. I'd definitely come back if I'm in the area!

One of the best pizza places I've been to. Got the Mediterranean 16" and large house salad and it was enough for 2 people plus leftover pizza. Cool bar and I like the cozy atmosphere. Service was a bit slow and not too friendly. Salad came out fast and pizza was came out in reasonable time. Good value.

Wow. This a perfect place for hanging with friends and family. The environment is relaxed. The workers are focused on great customer service. I ordered the salad, gluten free pepperoni pizza and Mr. Pibb. I enjoyed watching the pizza making theater happening in the window. The guys preparing the pizzas were having so much fun making the pizzas. I could tell they enjoy what they do as well as each other. Its probably why my pizza tasted so good. There was soft crisp texture to the crust and the sauce was sweet tomato with a hint of peppers. I also love the sliced tomatoes in my salad.  They too were sweet. Also the price was amazing. I was really surprised who cheap my meal was. Wish I could get them 6 or 7 stars!
Place was pretty cozy. You can eat inside or out. First time there and won't be last. Pizza was very good. Staff made Bazbeaux feel you welcomed
I mostly get here for lunch where you walk up and buy by the slice. Each day they sell four different pizzas by the slice. You can also order from the menu if you wish.

name: Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse
address: 51 N Illinois St, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: Honestly one of the best steakhouses in the city. Service is always excellent and the food is even better. Can never go wrong with a smoked old fashioned and a tomahawk steak.

Came here for the Wagyu Steak, and it is absolutely worth it! I thought it was fun how they had a certificate of authenticity for my steak and how they showed us the steak before it was cooked. Absolutely beautiful inside and the chairs for the tables are really comfortable. We had carrot cake for dessert and frankly we needed more people because the slice was giant! Photos don't do it justice. Make sure you get some coffee with your dessert because it is amazing. The staff is phenomenal and they were extremely helpful with all of our questions!

To start I wish I had more pictures of the other food I had as well, but it was just so good I completely forgot. This was the second time I’ve had wagyu beef and I must say, it never disappoints. For anyone that has never tried it before I highly recommend it.
Went for my boyfriend and I's second anniversary, and our minds were BLOWN! Fabulous food, staff, and ambience! One of the best culinary experiences I've had for sure. We will be back!

The magnificent atmosphere, the cheerful wait staff, and the memorable food were all beyond spectacular! The buttery filet mignon and the succulent lobster tail that melted in your mouth were some of the best I've ever had! We went for our 5 year anniversary and we received a wonderful note from the staff giving us their best wishes as well as a smores dessert that was warm and ooey gooey! May not be a normal date night trip but definitely worth the special occasion trip!

name: Hedge Row American Bistro
address: 350 Massachusetts Ave Suite 150, Indianapolis, IN 46204, USA
reviews: We love going to Hedge Row for Sunday brunch. Their bottomless mimosas are a great deal. The farmers breakfast or the burger are usually my go to order. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Patio is awesome when the weather is nice. Typically we do not have a long wait time for a table which is rare on Mass Ave.

Loved it.
Great menu of starters and sides. Actually had an entire meal from that, without trying the main courses. The Brussels sprouts are amazing, and so is the pork skewers.

Will definitely return when back in town

The dishes were flavorful. Good size portion, but definitely not "a lot" on any plate. Spicy stuff was actually spicy and not mainstream spicy. Cocktails were pretty good, we had a couple of the signature cocktails and were not disappointed. Service was not the most cheerful but was speedy so I wouldn't complain but others might. Environment is clean, modern yet pretty warm. Overall, definitely a nice location for adult meals. I would not recommend for kids. I don't know if they had a kids menu but the main menu is not very kid friendly items.

Hedge Row is a lively bistro. Food was well prepared and delicious. Vibe is very relaxing, warm, and inviting. While enjoyable and unique, the cocktails could be a greater volume for the price. Service could use a polish—uncomfortably long waits between waitstaff stops and had to flag once or twice. Otherwise great!

This is a nice establishment with a unique restaurant lay out and open kitchen concept.  We enjoyed our food, which you could tell was all made with fresh ingredients.  

We ordered the hush puppies, which I typically don’t enjoy, but these were phenomenal especially with the syrup on top.  The kale chicken salad was prepared well with tons of great ingredients making it tasty.  Lastly, the chicken sandwich was the least favorite of ours, but it was still good just not great.  However, the fries save this dish because those things are some of the best fries I’ve ever encountered.  

Everyone at the restaurant was friendly and genuine it seemed, besides our server.  She just seem disengaged and in auto pilot.  Honestly that’s the only reason I gave a 4/5.  I’ll still definitely go back because everyone has an off day and the food was incredible!
